quote: Happiness is not a station to arrive at  but a manner of traveling.
author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

quote: Happiness is to be found along the way  not at the end of the road  for then the journey is over and it is too late.
author: Robert R. Updegraff

quote: You wear yourself out in the pursuit of wealth or love or freedom  you do everything to gain some right  and once it's gained you take no pleasure in it.
author: Oriana Fallaci

quote: Success is counted sweetest by those who ne'er succeed.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Granting our wish is one of Fate's saddest jokes.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Now that I'm here  where am I?
author: Janis Joplin

quote: Success is not greedy  as people think  but insignificant. That's why it satisfies nobody.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Is there anything in life so disenchanting as attainment?
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Nothing fails like success  nothing is so defeated as yesterday's triumphant cause.
author: Phyllis McGinley

quote: Success has ruined many a man.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Fame always brings loneliness. Success is as ice cold and lonely as the North Pole.
author: Vicki Baum

quote: Success has killed more men than bullets.
author: Texas Guinan

quote: Achievement: The death of an endeavor  and the birth of disgust.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Success and failure are equally disastrous.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: The problems of victory are more agreeable than those of defeat  but they are no less difficult.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: We are never further from our wishes than when we imagine that we possess what we have desired.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Some aspects of success seem rather silly as death approaches.
author: Donald A. Miller

quote: Unless a man has been taught what to do with success after getting it  the achievement of it must inevitably leave him a prey to boredom.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: If I had known what it would be like to have it all  I might have been willing to settle for less.
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: Success and failure are both difficult to endure. Along with success come drugs  divorce  fornication  bullying  travel  meditation  medication  depression  neurosis and suicide. With failure comes failure.
author: Joseph Heller

quote: The best thing that can come with success is the knowledge that it is nothing to long for.
author: Liv Ullmann

quote: The closer one gets to the top  the more one finds there is no "top."
author: Nancy Barcus

quote: Oh  how quickly the world's glory passes away.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: The minute you think you've got it made  disaster is just around the corner.
author: Joe Paterno

quote: Creating success is tough. But keeping it is tougher. You have to keep producing  you can't ever stop.
author: Pete Rose

quote: Out of every fruition of success  no matter what  comes forth something to make a new effort necessary.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The toughest thing about success is that you've got to keep on being a success. Talent is only a starting point in business. You've got to keep working that talent.
author: Irving Berlin

quote: We would often be sorry if our wishes were gratified.
author: Aesop

quote: Nothing except a battle lost can be half so melancholy as a battle won.
author: Arthur Wellesley

quote: Being frustrated is disagreeable  but the real disasters of life begin when you get what you want.
author: Irving Kristol

quote: We grow weary of those things (and perhaps soonest) which we most desire.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Oddly enough  success over a period of time is more expensive than failure.
author: Grant Tinker

quote: There must be more to life than having everything!
author: Maurice Sendak

quote: It's not that I'm not grateful for all this attention. It's just that fame and fortune ought to add up to more than fame and fortune.
author: Robert Fulghum

quote: If you live long enough  you'll see that every victory turns into a defeat.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: One more such victory and we are undone.
author: Pyrrhus

quote: Pray that success will not come any faster than you are able to endure it.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: The prospect of success in achieving our most cherished dream is not without its terrors. Who is more deprived and alone than the man who has achieved his dream?
author: Brendan Francis

quote: Success can also cause misery. The trick is not to be surprised when you discover it doesn't bring you all the happiness and answers you thought it would.
author: Prince

quote: Adversity is sometimes hard upon a man  but for one man who can stand prosperity  there are a hundred that will stand adversity.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: To me success means effectiveness in the world  that I am able to carry my ideas and values into the world-that I am able to change it in positive ways.
author: Maxine Hong Kingston

quote: If you have a good name  if you are right more often than you are wrong  if your children respect you  if your grandchildren are glad to see you  if your friends can count on you and you can count on them in time of trouble  if you can face your God and say "I have done my best " then you are a success.
author: Ann Landers

quote: Life is a succession of moments. To live each one is to succeed.
author: Corita Kent

quote: I personally measure success in terms of the contributions an individual makes to his or her fellow human beings.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: He has achieved success  who has lived well  laughed often  and loved much  who has gained the respect of intelligent men and the love of little children.
author: Bessie A. Stanley

quote: Success has nothing to do with what you gain in life or accomplish for yourself. It's what you do for others.
author: Danny Thomas

quote: If you have a good name  if you are right more often than you are wrong  if your children respect you  if your grandchildren are glad to see you  if your friends can count on you and you can count on them in time of trouble  if you can face your God and say  "I have done my best " then you are a success.
author: Ann Landers

quote: Success is the sweetest revenge.
author: Vanessa Williams

quote: You have reached the pinnacle of success as soon as you become uninterested in money  compliments  or publicity.
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: A woman who is loved always has success.
author: Vicki Baum

quote: Success is not a doorway  it's a staircase.
author: Dottie Walters

quote: There is no scientific answer for success. You can't define it. You've simply got to live it and do it.
author: Anita Roddick

quote: Marconi invented radio  but Ted Husing knew what to do with it.
author: Ralph Edwards

quote: The ultimate of being successful is the luxury of giving yourself the time to do what you want to do.
author: Leontyne Price

quote: I don't think success is harmful  as so many people say. Rather I believe it indispensible to talent: if for nothing else than to increase the talent.
author: Jeanne Moreau

quote: Success produces success  just as money produces money.
author: Nicolas de Chamfort

quote: If I do have some success  I'd like to enjoy it  for heaven's sake! What is the point of having it otherwise?
author: Leontyne Price

quote: God may allow His servant to succeed when He has disciplined him to a point where he does not need to succeed to be happy. The man who is elated by success and is cast down by failure is still a carnal man. At best his fruit will have a worm in it.
author: A. W. Tozer

quote: There is no business in the world so troublesome as the pursuit of fame: life is over before you have hardly begun your work.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: Nothing fails like success because we don't learn from it. We learn only from failure.
author: Kenneth Boulding

quote: The insight to see possible new paths  the courage to try them  the judgment to measure results-these are the qualities of a leader.
author: Mary Parker Follett

quote: Success makes men rigid and they tend to exalt stability over all the other virtues  tired of the effort of willing  they become fanatics about conservatism.
author: Walter Lippman

quote: Success is a great healer.
author: Gertrude Atherton

quote: All outward success  when it has value  is but the inevitable result of an inward success of full living  full play and enjoyment of one's faculties.
author: Robert Henri

quote: There are three types of baseball players-those who make it happen  those who watch it happen  and those who wonder what happened.
author: Tommy Lasorda

quote: The exclusive worship of the bitch-goddess Success is our national disease.
author: William James

quote: Success causes us to be more praised than known.
author: Joseph Roux

quote: Along with success comes a reputation for wisdom.
author: Euripides

quote: Fame has only the span of the day  they say. But to live in the hearts of people-that is worth something.
author: Ouida

quote: Great men have not been concerned with fame. The joy of achievement that comes from finding something new in the universe is by far their greatest joy.
author: William P. King

quote: Out of the strain of the Doing  into the peace of the Done.
author: Julia Louise Woodruff

quote: Success is like a liberation  or the first phase of a love affair.
author: Jeanne Moreau

quote: There is always room at the top.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: An act of love that fails is just as much a part of the divine life as an act of love that succeeds  for love is measured by its own fullness  not by its reception.
author: Harold Loukes

quote: The best place to succeed is where you are with what you have.
author: Charles M. Schwab

quote: How to succeed: try hard enough. How to fail: Try too hard.
author: Malcolm Forbes

quote: I have found that it is much easier to make a success in life than to make a success of one's life.
author: G. W. Follin

quote: There could be no honor in a sure success  but much might be wrested from a sure defeat.
author: T. E. Lawrence

quote: Bad will be the day for every man when he becomes absolutely contented with the life he is living  when there is not forever beating at the doors of his soul some great desire to do something larger.
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: When there is no feeling of accomplishment  children fail to develop properly and old people rapidly decline.
author: Joseph Whitney

quote: Those who have easy  cheerful attitudes tend to be happier than those with less pleasant temperaments  regardless of money  "making it " or success.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quote: Theirs is not to reason why  theirs is but to do or die.
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

quote: Victory at all costs  victory in spite of all terror  victory however long and hard the hard may be  for without victory there is no survival.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: In war there is no second prize for the runner-up.
author: General Omar N. Bradley

quote: Success is simply a matter of luck. Ask any failure.
author: Earl Wilson

quote: Success didn't spoil me  I've always been insufferable.
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: He must really be a big success -  even his mother-in-law admits it.
author: Elmer Pasta

quote: The only time you find success before work is in the dictionary.
author: May V. Smith

quote: The haves and the have-nots can often be traced back to the dids and the did-nots.
author: D. O. Flynn

quote: Behind every successful man is a woman - with nothing to wear.
author: L. Grant Glickman

quote: She's the kind of woman who climbed the ladder of success  wrong by wrong.
author: Mae West

quote: This guy put the suck in success.
author: David Letterman

quote: As soon as you find the key to success  somebody always changes the lock.
author: Tracey Ullman

quote: The penalty of success is to be bored by the people who used to snub you.
author: Lady Nancy Astor

quote: Certainly I believe in luck. How else do you explain the success of those you don't like?
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: Behold the turtle. He makes progress only when he sticks his neck out.
author: James Conant

quote: If at first you don't succeed  try  try  again. Then quit. There's no use being a damn fool about it.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: A leading authority is anyone who has guessed right more than once.
author: Frank A. Clark

quote: The nice thing about being a celebrity is that when you bore people  they think it's their fault.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: My formula for success is rise early  work late  and strike oil.
author: J. Paul Getty

quote: Sleep  riches  and health  to be truly enjoyed  must be interrupted.
author: Jean Paul Richter

quote: Sometimes "the fool who rushes in" gets the job done.
author: Al Bernstein

quote: I've always wanted to be somebody  but I see now I should have been more specific.
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: Ideas are like rabbits. You get a couple and learn how to handle them  and pretty soon you have a dozen.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: I'm a great believer in luck  and I find the harder I work the more I have of it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Luck is a matter of preparation meeting opportunity.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: There is some consolation in the fact that  even though your dreams don't come true  neither do your nightmares.
author: Richard Armour

quote: Success to me is having ten honeydew melons and eating only the top half of each one.
author: Barbra Streisand

quote: If your ship doesn't come in  swim out to it.
author: Jonathan Winters

quote: We can't all be heroes because someone has to sit on the curb and clap as they go by.
author: Will Rogers

quote: If you lose  you're going to be fired  and if you win  you only put off the day you're going to be fired.
author: Leo Durocher

quote: Success can make you go one of two ways. It can make you a prima donna  or it can smooth the edges  take away the insecurities  let the nice things come out.
author: Barbara Walters

quote: Successful minds work like a gimlet  - to a single point.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

quote: All you need in this life is ignorance and confidence  and then Success is sure.
author: S. L. Clemens

quote: Success is counted sweetest By those who ne'er succeed.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Nothing succeeds like success.
author: Alexander Dumas

quote: There are but two ways of rising in the world: either by one's own industry or profiting by the foolishness of others.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: I have always observed that to succeed in the world one should appear like a fool but be wise.
author: Charles Montesquieu

quote: Faith  mighty faith  the promise sees  And looks to that alone  Laughs at impossibilities  And cries it shall be done.
author: Charles Wesley

quote: Either do not attempt at all  or go through with it.
author: Ovid

quote: Somebodys said that it couldn't be done  But he with a chuckle replied That "maybe it couldn't " but he would be one Who wouldn't say so till he'd tried. So he buckled right in with the trace of a grin On his face. If he worried he hid it. He started to sing as he tackled the thing That couldn't be done  and he did it.
author: Edgar A. Guest

quote: And he gave it for his opinion  that whoever could make two ears of corn  or two blades of grass  to grow upon a spot of ground where only one grew before  would deserve better of mankind and do more essential service to his country  than the whole race of politicians put together.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: It requires more courage to suffer than to die.
author: Napoleon

quote: No pain  no palm  no thorns  no throne  no gall  no glory  no cross  no crown.
author: William Penn

quote: We are healed of a suffering only by experiencing it to the full.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: I reckon that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory which shall be revealed in us.
author: Romans

quote: I have a hundred times wished that one could resign life as an officer resigns a commission.
author: Robert Burns

quote: It is cowardice to commit suicide.
author: Napoleon

quote: There is no refuge from confession but suicide  and suicide is confession.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: One swallow alone does not make the summer.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Oh  the summer night Has a smile of light And she sits on a sapphire throne.
author: B. W. Procter

quote: Make hay while the sun shines.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Whence are thy beams  O sun! thy everlasting light? Thou comest forth  in thy awful beauty  the stars hide themselves in the sky  the moon  cold and pale  sinks in the western wave. But thou  thyself  movest alone.
author: James MacPherson

quote: The sun shines even on the wicked.
author: Seneca

quote: There are three marks of a superior man: being virtuous  he is free from anxiety  being wise  he is free from perplexity  being brave  he is free from fear.
author: Confucius

quote: We can all perceive the difference between ourselves and our inferiors  but when it comes to a question of the difference between us and our superiors we fail to appreciate merits of which we have no proper conceptions.
author: James Fenimore Cooper

quote: Superiority is always detested.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: The general root of superstition is that men observe when things hit  and not when they miss  and commit to memory the one  and forget and pass over the other.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: Superstition is the religion of feeble minds.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: I die adoring God  loving my friends  not hating my enemies  and detesting superstition.
author: Voltaire

quote: Religion is not removed by removing superstition.
author: Cicero

quote: There is in superstition a senseless fear of God.
author: Cicero

quote: Suspicion is far more apt to be wrong than right  oftener unjust than just. It is no friend to virtue  and always an enemy to happiness.
author: Hosea Ballou

quote: As to Caesar  when he was called upon  he gave no testimony against Clodius  nor did he affirm that he was certain of any injury done to his bed. He only said  "He had divorced Pompeia because the wife of Caesar ought not only to be clear of such a crime  but of the very suspicion of it."
author: Plutarch

quote: The less we know the more we suspect.
author: H. W. Shaw

quote: A woman of honor should not suspect another of things she would not do herself.
author: Marguerite de Valois

quote: All our geese are swans.
author: Henry Burton

quote: You think that upon the score of fore-knowledge and divining I am infinitely inferior to the swans. When they perceive approaching death they sing more merrily than before  because of the joy they have in going to the God they serve.
author: Socrates

quote: The pursuit of the perfect  then  is the pursuit of sweetness and light.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: Sweet meat must have sour sauce.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: Of a truth  men are mystically united: a mystic bond of brotherhood makes all men one.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: The man who melts With social sympathy  though not allied  Is of more worth than a thousand kinsmen.
author: Euripides

quote: He watch'd and wept  he pray'd and felt for all.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: Never elated while one man's oppress'd  Never dejected while another's bless'd.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Rejoice with them that do rejoice  and weep with them that weep.
author: Romans

quote: No one really understands the grief or joy of another.
author: Franz Schubert

quote: A timid question will always receive a confident answer.
author: Lord Darling

quote: "Let us agree not to step on each other's feet " said the cock to the horse.
author: English proverb

quote: If a person has no delicacy  he has you in his power.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Silence is not always tact  and it is tact that is golden  not silence.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Diplomats are useful only in fair weather. As soon as it rains  they drown in every drop.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: Negotiation in the classic diplomatic sense assumes parties more anxious to agree than to disagree.
author: Dean Acheson

quote: Diplomacy  the art of saying 'nice doggie' till you can find a rock.
author: Wynn Catlin

quote: If any pilgrim monk come from distant parts  with wish as a guest to dwell in the monastery  and will be content with the customs which he finds in the place  and does not perchance by his lavishness disturb the monastery  but is simply content with what he finds  he shall be received for as long as he desires. If  indeed  he find fault with anything  or expose it  reasonably  and with the humility of charity  the Abbott shall discuss it prudently lest perchance God had sent him for this very thing. But  if he have been found gossipy and contumacious in the time of his sojourn as guest  not only ought he not be joined to the body of the monastery  but also  it shall be said to him  honestly  that he must depart. If he does not go  let two stout monks  in the name of God  explain the matter to him.
author: Saint Benedict

quote: An ambassador is an honest man sent to lie abroad for the good of his country.
author: Henry Wotton

quote: Women and foxes  being weak  are distinguished by superior tact.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Without tact you can learn nothing.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: A schoolboy's tale  the wonder of an hour.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Tush! These are trifles  and mere old wives' tales.
author: Christopher Marlowe

quote: What so tedious as a twice-told tale?
author: Alexander Pope

quote: I cannot tell how the truth may be  I say the tale as 'twas said to me.
author: Walter Scott

quote: A tale never loses in the telling.
author: Scottish proverb

quote: All our talents increase in the using  and every faculty both good and bad  strengthens by exercise.
author: Anne Bronte

quote: Conciseness is the sister of talent.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Genius does what it must  and talent does what it can.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: In this world people have to pay an extortionate price for any exceptional gift whatever.
author: Willa Cather

quote: There is no substitute for talent. Industry and all the virtures are of no avail.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Talent is always conscious of its own abundance  and does not object to sharing.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: The luck of having talent is not enough  one must also have a talent for luck.
author: Hector Berlioz

quote: A talent somewhat above mediocrity  shrewd and not too sensitive  is more likely to rise in the world than genius  which is apt to be perturbable and to wear itself out before fruition.
author: Charles Horton Cooley

quote: Great talents are the most lovely and often the most dangerous fruits on the tree of humanity. They hang upon the most slender twigs that are easily snapped off.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Everyone has a talent. What is rare is the courage to follow the talent to the dark places where it leads.
author: Erica Jong

quote: The crowning blessing of life - to be born with a bias to some pursuit.
author: S. C. Tallentyre

quote: Concealed talent brings no reputation.
author: Erasmus

quote: The world is always ready to receive talent with open arms.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: "The time has come " the Walrus said  "To talk of many things  Of shoes - and ships - and sealing-wax -  Of cabbages - and kings -  And why the sea is boiling hot -  And whether pigs have wings."
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: But far more numerous was the herd of stfch  Who think too little  and who talk too much.
author: John Dryden

quote: Talk is cheap.
author: English proverb

quote: In much of your talking  thinking is half murdered.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: They never taste who always drink  They always talk who never think.
author: Matthew Prior

quote: In general those who nothing have to say Contrive to spend the longest time in doing it.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Those who have few things to attend to are great babblers  for the less men think  the more they talk.
author: Charles Montesquieu

quote: He who talks too much commits a sin.
author: Talmud

quote: The secret of being tiresome is in telling everything.
author: Voltaire

quote: Everyone carries his own inch-rule of taste  and amuses himself by applying it  triumphantly  wherever he travels.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Talking is like playing on the harp  there is as much in laying the hand on the strings to stop their vibrations as in twanging them to bring out their music.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Good taste is the first refuge of the non-creative. It is the last ditch stand of the artist.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: It is good taste  and good taste alone  that possesses the power to sterilize and is always the first handicap to any creative functioning.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: Taste is the feminine of genius.
author: Edward Fitzgerald

quote: Taste is the enemy of creativeness.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Have nothing in your houses that you do not know to be useful  or believe to be beautiful.
author: William Morris

quote: Style is a simple way of saying complicated things.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: Fashion exists for women with no taste  etiquette for people with no breeding.
author: Queen Marie of Rumania

quote: People care more about being thought to have good taste than about being thought either good  clever or amiable.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: We all have some taste or other  of too ancient a date to admit of our remembering that it was an acquired one.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Good taste and humour are a contradiction in terms  like a chaste whore.
author: Malcolm Muggeridge

quote: Taste cannot be controlled by law.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: One of the surest signs of the Philistine is his reverence for the superior tastes of those who put him down.
author: Pauline Kael

quote: One man's poison ivy is another man's spinach.
author: George Ade

quote: Taste is nothing but a delicate good sense.
author: M. J. De Chenier

quote: Everyone to his taste.
author: French proverb

quote: My tastes are aristocratic  my actions democratic.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: A man's palate can  in time  become accustomed to anything.
author: Napoleon

quote: Good taste is the flower of good sense.
author: Poincelot

quote: The finer impulse of our nature.
author: Friedrich von Schiller

quote: Every man as he loveth  quoth the good man when he kissed the cow.
author: John Heywood

quote: The power to tax involves the power to destroy.
author: John Marshall

quote: The art of taxation consists in so plucking the goose as to get the most feathers with the least hissing.
author: Jean Baptiste Colbert

quote: The point to remember is that what the government gives it must first take away.
author: John S. Coleman

quote: Next to being shot at and missed  nothing is quite as satisfying as an income tax refund.
author: F. J. Raymond

quote: The income tax has made more liars out of the American people than golf has. Even when you make a tax form out on the level  you don't know when it's through  if you are a crook or a martyr.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Governments last as long as the under-taxed can defend themselves against the over-taxed.
author: Bernard Berenson

quote: The promises of yesterday are the taxes of today.
author: William Lyon Mackenzie King

quote: The art of taxation consists in so plucking the goose as to obtain the largest amount of feathers with the least possible amount of hissing.
author: J. B. Colbert

quote: Death and taxes are inevitable.
author: Thomas Haliburton

quote: First he wrought  and afterwards he taught.
author: Geoffrey Chaucer

quote: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: The school teacher is certainly underpaid as a child minder  but ludicrously overpaid as an educator.
author: John Osborne

quote: There is no crisis to which academics will not respond with a seminar.
author: Old saying

quote: A teacher affects eternity  he can never tell where his influence stops.
author: Henry Adams

quote: It would be a great advantage to some schoolmasters if they would steal two hours a day from their pupils  and give their own minds the benefit of the robbery.
author: J. F. Boyse

quote: To teach is to learn twice.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: The authority of those who profess to teach is often a positive hindrance to those who desire to learn.
author: Cicero

quote: Teaching is not a lost art  but the regard for it is a lost tradition.
author: Jacques Barzun

quote: A high-school teacher  after all  is a person deputized by the rest of us to explain to the young what sort of world they are living in  and to defend  if possible  the part their elders are playing in it.
author: Entile Capouya

quote: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: No man can reveal to you aught but that which already lies half asleep in the dawning of your knowledge.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: The first duty of a lecturer- to hand you after an hour's discourse a nugget of pure truth to wrap up between the pages of your notebooks and keep on the mantelpiece for ever.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: We teach what we need to learn and write what we need to know.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: A man should first direct himself in the way he should go. Only then should he instruct others.
author: Buddha

quote: You cannot teach a man anything  you can only help him to find it within himself.
author: Galileo

quote: A teacher who is attempting to teach without inspiring the pupil with a desire to learn is hammering on cold iron.
author: Horace Mann

quote: Public instruction should be the first object of government.
author: Napoleon

quote: Tears are Summer showers to the soul.
author: Alfred Austin

quote: For Beauty's tears are lovelier than her smile.
author: Thomas Campbell

quote: Words that weep and tears that speak.
author: Abraham Cowley

quote: Never a tear bedims the eye That time and patience will not dry.
author: Bret Harte

quote: Oh! would I were dead now  Or up in my bed now  To cover my head now And have a good cry!
author: Thomas Hood

quote: There shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
author: Matthew

quote: It is some relief to weep  grief is satisfied and carried off by tears.
author: Ovid

quote: Tears are the silent language of grief.
author: Voltaire

quote: All television is educational television. The question is: what is it teaching?
author: Nicholas Johnson

quote: He who prides himself on giving what he thinks the public wants is often creating a fictitious demand for low standards which he will then satisfy.
author: Lord Reith

quote: Of all the dramatic media  radio is the most visual.
author: John Reeves

quote: Television? The word is half Latin and half Greek. No good can come of it.
author: C. P. Scott

quote: Television's compelling power is its immediacy . .. this immediacy feeds the politics of emotions  gut reactions and impressions rather than the politics of logic  facts and reason  it emphasizes personality rather than issues.
author: Hedrick Smith

quote: Television is the literature of the illiterate  the culture of the low-brow  the wealth of the poor  the privilege of the underprivileged  the exclusive club of the excluded masses.
author: Lee Loevinger

quote: I can get a better grasp of what is going on in the world from one good Washington dinner party than from all the background information NBC piles on my desk.
author: Barbara Walters

quote: When television is good  nothing is better. But when television is bad  nothing is worse. I invite you to sit down in front of your TV set and keep your eyes glued to that set until the station signs off. I can assure you that you will observe a vast wasteland.
author: Newton Minow

quote: Television has proved that people will look at anything rather than each other.
author: Ann Landers

quote: Television is a gold goose that lays scrambled eggs  and it is futile and probably fatal to beat it for not laying caviar.
author: Lee Loevinger

quote: Television is chewing gum for the eyes.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: In the age of television  image becomes more important than substance.
author: S. J. Hayakawa

quote: Television is the first truly democratic culture - the first culture available to everybody and entirely governed by what the people want. The most terrifying thing is what people do want.
author: Clive Barnes

quote: Television has a real problem. They have no page two.
author: Art Buchwald

quote: Good heavens  television is something you appear on  you don't watch.
author: Noel Coward

quote: Television is an invention that permits you to be entertained in your living room by people you wouldn't have in your home.
author: David Frost

quote: Why should people pay good money to go out and see bad films when they can stay at home and see bad television for nothing?
author: Sam Goldwyn

quote: The television commercial is the most efficient power-packed capsule of education that appears anywhere on TV.
author: C. L. Gray

quote: Television is not the truth. Television is a god-damned amusement park. Television is a circus  a carnival  a travelling troupe of acrobats  storytellers dancers  singers  jugglers  sideshow freaks  lion tamers and football players. We're in the boredom-killing business.
author: Paddy Chayefsky

quote: Dictum on television scripts: We don't want it good - we want it Tuesday.
author: Dennis Norden

quote: I've had several years in Hollywood and I still think the movie heroes are in the audience.
author: Wilson Mizner

quote: The first draught serveth for health  the second for pleasure  the third for shame  and the fourth for madness.
author: Anacharsis

quote: Every moderate drinker could abandon the intoxicating cup if he would  every inebriate would if he could.
author: J. B. Gough

quote: Drinking water neither makes a man sick  nor in debt  nor his wife a widow.
author: John Neale

quote: The smaller the drink  the clearer the head  and the cooler the blood.
author: William Penn

quote: All men are tempted. There is no man that lives that can't be broken down  provided it is the right temptation  put in the right spot.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Temptation rarely comes in working hours. It is in their leisure time that men are made or marred.
author: W. M. Taylor

quote: Things forbidden have a secret charm.
author: Tacitus

quote: After listening to thousands of pleas for pardon to offenders  I can hardly recall a case where I did not feel that I might have fallen as my fellow man had done  if I had been subjected to the same demoralizing influences and pressed by the same temptations.
author: Horatio Seymour

quote: I have a simple principle for the conduct of life - never to resist an adequate temptation.
author: Max Lerner

quote: If the world were merely seductive  that would be easy. If it were merely challenging  that would be no problem. But I rise in the morning torn between a desire to improve (or save) the world and a desire to enjoy (or savour) the world. This makes it hard to plan the day.
author: E. B. White

quote: Never give in  never give in  never  never  never  never - in nothing great or small  large or petty - never give in except to convictions of honour and good sense.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: I generally avoid temptation unless I can't resist it.
author: Mae West

quote: Honest bread is very well - it's the butter that makes the temptation.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: Get thee behind me  Satan.
author: Matthew

quote: One thing I can guarantee you. You may not be a great deal wiser from my talk today  but you will be a great deal older.
author: Melvin Helitzer

quote: I want to thank everybody who made this day necessary.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: I really don't deserve this  but I have arthritis and I don't deserve that either.
author: Jack Benny

quote: I explained to him I had simple tastes and didn't want anything ostentatious  no matter what it costs.
author: Art Buchwald

quote: I feel a very unusual sensation - if it is not indigestion  I think it must be gratitude.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: I forgot they were talking about me. They sound so wonderfully convincing.
author: Jean Giraudoux

quote: The audience was swell. They were so polite they covered their mouths when they yawned.
author: Bob Hope

quote: I've been here so long . . . when I got here the Dead Sea wasn't even sick yet.
author: Wimp Sanderson

quote: It is almost impossible to find those who admire us entirely lacking in taste.
author: J. Petit-Senn

quote: Admiration: Our polite recognition of another man's resemblance to ourselves.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: A good storyteller is a person who has a good memory and hopes other people haven't.
author: Irvin S. Cobb

quote: The trouble with most of us is that we would rather be ruined by praise than saved by criticism.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: A sense of humor is the ability to laugh at your own jokes when your friends tell them.
author: Patricia Jasper Clark

quote: The trouble with eating Italian food is that five or six days later you're hungry again.
author: George Miller

quote: Nouvelle cuisine  roughly translated  means "I can't believe I spent ninety-six dollars and I'm still hungry."
author: Mike Kalin

quote: I've had a wonderful evening . . . but this wasn't it.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: A conclusion is the place where you got tired of thinking.
author: Martin H. Fischer

quote: Ladies and gentlemen  you can't please everyone. Take my girlfriend - I think she's the most remarkable woman in the world. . . . That's me . . . But to my wife . . .
author: Jackie Mason

quote: It is always dullest before the yawn.
author: Bob Phillips

quote: I'd like to thank the committee that brought this event about. It was an equal endeavor. They did the food  decorations  and reservations  and I did the traffic flow.
author: Wendy Morgan

quote: Better to be king for a night than a schmuck for a lifetime.
author: Robert De Niro

quote: Another fine mess you've got us in  Stanley.
author: Oliver Hardy

quote: He who laughs last  thinks slowest.
author: Troy Anderson

quote: Let's face it  some days you're the pigeon and some days you're the statue.
author: Maria Morgan

quote: If there is anyone here whom I have not insulted  I beg his pardon.
author: Johannes Brahms

quote: Don't move! I want to forget you just the way you are.
author: Henny Youngman

quote: I thank you for not snoring.
author: Marlon Brando

quote: Heap high the board with plenteous cheer  and gather to the feast  And toast the sturdy Pilgrim band whose courage never ceased. Give praise to that All-Gracious One by whom their steps were led  And thanks unto the harvest's Lord who sends our "daily bread."
author: Alice Williams

quote: Brotherton So once in every year we throng Upon a day apart  To praise the Lord with feast and song In thankfulness of heart.
author: Arthur Guiterman

quote: Fear is the denomination of the Old Testament  belief is the denomination of the New.
author: Benjamin Whichcote

quote: The English of the Bible has a pithiness and raciness  a homely tang  a terse sententiousness  an idiomatic flavour which comes home to men's business and bosoms ... a nobility of diction and ... a rhythmic quality . . . unrivaled in its beauty.
author: John Livingston Lowes

quote: The total absence of humour in the Bible is one of the most singular things in all literature.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: The Old and New Testaments are the Great Code of Art.
author: William Blake

quote: When caught reading the Bible  W.C. Fields said T'm looking for loopholes.' The Bible is nothing but a succession of civil rights struggles by the Jewish people against their oppressors.
author: Jesse Jackson

quote: The bible should be taught so early and so thoroughly that it sinks straight to the bottom of the mind where everything that comes along can settle on it.
author: Northrop Frye

quote: A great city is not to be confounded with a populous one.
author: Aristotle

quote: A hick town is one in which there is no place to go where you shouldn't be.
author: Alexander Woollcott

quote: We might define an eccentric as a man who is law unto himself  and a crank as one who having determined what the law is  insists on laying it down to others.
author: Louis Kronenberger

quote: The country has charms only for those not obliged to stay there.
author: Edouard Manet

quote: A great city  a great solitude.
author: Old proverb

quote: In small settlements everyone knows your affairs. In the big city  everyone does not - only those you choose to tell will know about you. This is one of the attributes of cities that is precious to most city people.
author: Jane Jacobs

quote: If you would be known  and not know  vegetate in a village  if you would know and not be known  live in a city.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Farmers worry only during the growing season  but town people worry all the time.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: As a remedy to life in society  I would suggest the big city. Nowadays it is the only desert within our reach.
author: Albert Camus

quote: All cities are mad: but the madness is gallant. All cities are beautiful: but the beauty is grim.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: The chicken is the country's  but the city eats it.
author: George Herbert

quote: The city is a cultural invention enforcing on the citizen knowledge of his own nature. And this we do not like. That we are aggressive beings  easily given to violence  that we get along together because we must more than because we want to  and that the brotherhood of man is about as far from reality today as it was two thousand years ago  that reason's realm is small  that we never have been and never shall be created equal  that if the human being is perfectible  he has so far exhibited few symptoms - all are considerations of man from which space tends to protect us.
author: Robert Ardrey

quote: There is nothing good to be had in the country  or  if there be  they will not let you have it.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: The axis of the earth sticks out visibly through the centre of each and every town or city.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: To say the least  a town life makes one more tolerant and liberal in one's judgement of others.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Commuters give the city its tidal restlessness  natives give it solidity and continuity  but the settlers give it passion.
author: E. B. White

quote: Summertime  oh  summertime  pattern of life indelible  the fade-proof lake  the woods unshatterable  the pasture with the sweetfern and the juniper forever and ever . . . the cottages with their innocent and tranquil design  their tiny docks with the flagpole and the American flag floating against the white clouds in the blue sky  the little paths over the roots of the trees leading from camp to camp. This was the American family at play  escaping the city heat.
author: E. B. White

quote: There is no solitude in the world like that of the big city.
author: Kathleen Norris

quote: Upper classes are a nation's past  the middle-class is its future.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: People are afraid of the future  of the unknown. If a man faces up to it  and takes the dare of the future  he can have some control over his destiny. That's an exciting idea to me  better than waiting with everybody else to see what's going to happen.
author: John H. Glenn

quote: Tomorrow is the most important thing in life. Comes in to us at midnight very clean. It's perfect when it arrives and it puts itself in our hands and hopes we've learnt something from yesterday.
author: John Wayne

quote: Nothing in the world can one imagine beforehand  not the least thing. Everything is made up of so many unique particulars that cannot be foreseen.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: You can never plan the future by the past.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: One must care about a world one will not see.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The future is something which every one reaches at the rate of sixty miles an hour  whatever he does  whoever he is.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: My interest is in the future because I am going to spend the rest of my life there.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quote: Tomorrow is a satire on today  And shows its weakness.
author: Edward Young

quote: The future comes one day at a time.
author: Dean Acheson

quote: Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it  if you have to  with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: What we look for does not come to pass. God finds a way for what none foresaw.
author: Euripides

quote: With high hope for the future  no prediction is ventured.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: We can pay our debt to the past by putting the future in debt to ourselves.
author: John Buchan

quote: The future is not a gift - it is an achievement.
author: Harry Lauder

quote: The world is full of people whose notion of a satisfactory future is  in fact  a return to the idealized past.
author: Robertson Davies

quote: That which is escaped now is pain to come.
author: Proverbs

quote: Light tomorrow with today!
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: If tomorrow were never to come  it would not be worth living today.
author: Dagobert Runes

quote: The afternoon knows what the morning never suspected.
author: Swedish proverb

quote: Life is an irreversible process and for that reason its future can never be a repetition of the past.
author: Walter Lippman

quote: I believe the future is only the past again  entered through another gate.
author: Arthur Wing Pinero

quote: The world will be saved by one or two people.
author: Andre Gide

quote: It is a mistake to look too far ahead. Only one link in the chain of destiny can be handled at a time.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: It is seldom in life that one knows that a coming event is to be of crucial importance.
author: Anya Seton

quote: Neither in the life of the individual nor in that of mankind is it desirable to know the future.
author: Jakob Burckhardt

quote: There is only one large circle that we march in  around and around  each of us with our own little picture-in front of us-our own little mirage that we think is the future.
author: Lorraine Hansbury

quote: God made the world round so we would never be able to see too far down the road.
author: Isak Dinesen

quote: The future comes one day at a time.
author: Dean Acheson

quote: There is a case  and a strong case  for that particular form of indolence that allows us to move through life knowing only what immediately concerns us.
author: Alec Waugh

quote: Cease to inquire what the future has in store  and take as a gift whatever the day brings forth.
author: Horace

quote: There is no data on the future.
author: Laurel Cutler

quote: The best thing about the future is that it comes only one day at a time.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Hardly anyone knows how much is gained by ignoring the future.
author: Bernard de Fontenelle

quote: The future is hidden even from those who make it.
author: Anatole France

quote: They who lose today may win tomorrow.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Be of good cheer. Do not think of today's failures  but of the success that may come tomorrow. You have set yourselves a difficult task  but you will succeed if you persevere  and you will find a joy in overcoming obstacles. Remember  no effort that we make to attain something beautiful is ever lost.
author: Helen Keller

quote: When all else is lost  the future still remains.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: There is hope for all of us. Well  anyway  if you don't die you live through it  day in  day out.
author: Mary Beckett

quote: Our faith in the present dies out long before our faith in the future.
author: Ruth Benedict

quote: I have been nothing ... but there is tomorrow.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: After all  tomorrow is another day.
author: Scarlett O'Hara

quote: Everyone has it within his power to say  this I am today  that I shall be tomorrow.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: He who foresees calamities suffers them twice over.
author: Beilby Porteous

quote: Only man clogs his happiness with care  destroying what is with thoughts of what may be.
author: John Dryden

quote: It is never safe to look into the future with eyes of fear.
author: E. H. Harriman

quote: If you are afraid for your future  you don't have a present.
author: James Petersen

quote: He that fears not the future may enjoy the present.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: The future is called "perhaps " which is the only possible thing to call the future. And the important thing is not to allow that to scare you.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: To relinquish a present good through apprehension of a future evil is in most instances unwise ... from a fear which may afterwards turn out groundless  you lost the good that lay within your grasp.
author: Francesco Guicciardini

quote: Nothing in life is more remarkable than the unnecessary anxiety which we endure  and generally create ourselves.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Every man  through fear  mugs his aspirations a dozen times a day.
author: Brendan Francis

quote: The mere apprehension of a coming evil has put many into a situation of the utmost danger.
author: Lucan

quote: We need not be afraid of the future  for the future will be in our own hands.
author: Thomas E. Dewey

quote: I am not afraid of tomorrow  for I have seen yesterday and I love today.
author: William Allen White

quote: Go forth to meet the shadowy Future without fear and with a manly heart.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: We grow in time to trust the future for our answers.
author: Ruth Benedict

quote: Every tomorrow has two handles. We can take hold of it with the handle of anxiety or the handle of faith.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Put aside the need to know some future design and simply leave your life open to what is needed of it by the Divine forces.
author: Emmanuel

quote: See how time makes all grief decay.
author: Adelaide Proctor

quote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today. Let us move forward with strong and active faith.
author: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

quote: It is not the cares of today  but the cares of tomorrow  that weigh a man down. For the needs of today we have corresponding strength given. For the morrow we are told to trust. It is not ours yet.
author: George Macdonald

quote: Tomorrow is the day when idlers work  and fools reform  and mortal men lay hold on heaven.
author: Edward Young

quote: Tomorrow is the mysterious  unknown guest.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Tomorrow is the only day in the year that appeals to a lazy man.
author: Jimmy Lyons

quote: The future is something which everyone reaches at the rate of sixty minutes an hour  whatever he does  whoever he is.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: The future is a world limited by ourselves-in it we discover only what concerns us.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: The future is only the past again  entered through another gate.
author: Arthur Wing Pinero

quote: The future is the most expensive luxury in the world.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: The future is the shape of things to come.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: The future is the past in preparation.
author: Pierre Dae

quote: To the being of fully alive  the future is not ominous but a promise  it surrounds the present like a halo.
author: John Dewey

quote: The future is hope!
author: John Fiske

quote: The future is wider than vision  and has no end.
author: Donald G. Mitchell

quote: Losing the future is the best thing that ever happened to me.
author: Marilyn French

quote: Grow old along with me! The best is yet to be.
author: Robert Browning

quote: I have always been driven by some distant music-a battle hymn no doubt-for I have been at war from the beginning. I've never looked back before. I've never had the time and it has always seemed so dangerous.
author: Bette Davis

quote: He who lives in the future lives in a featureless blank  he lives in impersonality  he lives in Nirvana. The past is democratic  because it is a people. The future is despotic  because it is a caprice. Every man is alone in his prediction  just as each man is alone in a dream.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: When I look to the future  it's so bright  it burns my eyes.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: I like the dreams of the future better than the history of the past.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: I never think of the future. It comes soon enough.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: You cannot plan the future by the past.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: It is when tomorrow's burden is added to the burden of today that the weight is more than a man can bear.
author: George Macdonald

quote: My interest is in the future because I am going to spend the rest of my life there.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quote: Yesterday is not ours to recover  but tomorrow is ours to win or lose.
author: Lyndon B. Johnson

quote: Where will I be five years from now? I delight in not knowing. That's one of the greatest things about life-its wonderful surprises.
author: Mario Thomas

quote: When I look at the future  it's so bright  it burns my eyes.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Everyone's future is  in reality  uncertain and full of unknown treasures from which all may draw unguessed prizes.
author: Lord Dunsany

quote: The future is made of the same stuff as the present.
author: Simone Weil

quote: The future is much like the present  only longer.
author: Dan Quisenberry

quote: By-and-by never comes.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: The bridges you cross before you come to them are over rivers that aren't there.
author: Gene Brown

quote: Strike when thou wilt  the hour of rest  but let my last days be my best.
author: Robert Browning

quote: For you and me  today is all we have  tomorrow is a mirage that may never become reality.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: I fear there will be no future for those who do not change.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: I got the blues thinking of the future  so I left off and made some marmalade. It's amazing how it cheers one up to shred oranges and scrub the floor.
author: D. H. Lawrence

quote: You learn to build your roads on today  because tomorrow's ground is too uncertain for plans  and futures have a way of falling down in mid-flight.
author: Veronica Shoffstal

quote: Fortunately for children  the uncertainties of the present always give way to the enchanted possibilities of the future.
author: Gelsey Kirkland

quote: A house may draw visitors  but it is the possessor alone that can detain them.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: A man's home is his wife's castle.
author: Alexander Chase

quote: I want a house that has got over all its troubles  I don't want to spend the rest of my life bringing up a young and inexperienced house.
author: Jerome K. Jerome

quote: The surroundings householders crave are glorified autobiographies.
author: T. H. Robsjohn-Gibbings

quote: Home is not where you live but where they understand you.
author: Christian Morgenstern

quote: Where thou art  that  is Home.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Home is the place where  when you have to go there  They have to take you in.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The strength of a nation  especially of a republican nation  is in the intelligent and well-ordered homes of the people.
author: Lydia Sigourney

quote: Justice was born outside the home and a long way from it  and it has never been adopted there.
author: Walter Cronkite

quote: The home of everyone is to him his castle and fortress  as well for his defence against injury and violence  as for his repose.
author: Edward Coke

quote: Pride  avarice and envy are in every home.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: Of all modern notions  the worst is this: that domesticity is dull. Inside the home  they say  is dead decorum and routine  outside is adventure and variety. But the truth is that the home is the only place of liberty  the only spot on earth where a man can alter arrangements suddenly  make an experiment or indulge in a whim. The home is not the one tame place in a world of adventure  it is the one wild place in a world of rules and set tasks.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: I have come back again to where I belong  not an enchanted place  but the walls are strong.
author: Dorothy H. Rath

quote: To mankind in general Macbeth and Lady Macbeth stand out as the supreme type of all that a host and hostess should not be.
author: Max Beerbohm

quote: The fellow that owns his own home is always just coming out of a hardware store.
author: Kin Hubbard

quote: Common sense is the collection of prejudices acquired by age 18.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Curiosity is a lust of the mind.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: Gluttony is an emotional escape  a sign something is eating us.
author: Peter de Vries

quote: The heart of a statesman should be in his head.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Minds  like bodies  will often fall into a pimpled  ill-conditioned state from mere excess of comfort.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Of course  he seems to have quite a mind of his own and that is probably where he is weakest.
author: Arnold Schoenberg

quote: That is the consolation of a little mind  you have the fun of changing it without impeding the progress of mankind.
author: Frank Moore Colby

quote: The flesh endures the storms of the present alone  the mind  those of the past and future as well as the present.
author: Epicurus

quote: The mind of man is capable of anything - because everything is in it  all the past as well as all the future.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Then comes Winston with his hundred horsepower mind and what can I do?
author: Stanley Baldwin

quote: We know the human brain is a device to keep the ears from grating on one another.
author: Peter de Vries

quote: When the mind is thinking  it is talking to itself.
author: Plato

quote: I am not absent-minded. It is the presence of mind that makes me unaware of everything else.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Our unconsciousness is like a vast subterranean factory with intricate machinery that is never idle  where work goes on day and night from the time we are born until the moment of our death.
author: Milton R. Sapirstein

quote: Only an incompetent mind is content to express itself incompetently.
author: J. M. Barker

quote: A great many open minds should be closed for repairs.
author: Toledo Blade

quote: If you keep your mind sufficiently open  people will throw a lot of rubbish into it.
author: William A. Orton

quote: Merely having an open mind is nothing. The object of opening the mind  as of opening the mouth  is to shut it again on something solid.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: The perversion of the mind is only possible when those who should be heard in its defence are silent.
author: Archibald MacLeish

quote: Our minds are lazier than our bodies.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: Strength is a matter of the made-up mind.
author: John Beecher

quote: What we think and feel and are is to a great extent determined by the state of our ductless glands and our viscera.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The feeling of inferiority rules the mental life and can be clearly recognized as the sense of incompleteness and unfulfillment  and in the uninterrupted struggle both of individuals and of humanity.
author: Alfred Adler

quote: Discipline does not mean suppression and control  nor is it adjustment to a pattern or ideology. It means a mind that sees 'what is' and learns from 'what was'.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: That which enters the mind through reason can be corrected. That which is admitted through faith  hardly ever.
author: Santiago Ramon y Cajal

quote: Vanity plays lurid tricks with our memory.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Nostalgia is a seductive liar.
author: George W. Ball

quote: Was it always my nature to take a bad time and block out the good times  until any success became an accident and failure seemed the only truth?
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: Nostalgia: A device that removes the ruts and potholes from memory lane.
author: Doug Larson

quote: What was hard to bear is sweet to remember.
author: Portuguese proverb

quote: The heart's memory eliminates the bad and magnifies the good  and thanks to this artifice we manage to endure the burdens of the past.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

quote: Some folks never exaggerate-they just remember big.
author: Audrey Snead

quote: A man's memory may almost become the art of continually varying and misrepresenting his past  according to his interest in the present.
author: George Santayana

quote: God gave us memory that we might have roses in December.
author: Sir James M. Barrie

quote: There has never been an age that did not applaud the past and lament the present.
author: Lillian Eichler Watson

quote: Children today are tyrants. They contradict their parents  gobble their food  and tyrannize their teachers.
author: Socrates

quote: Posterity will say as usual: "In the past things were better  the present is worse than the past."
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Our ignorance of history makes us libel to our own times. People have always been like this.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: Oh  this age! How tasteless and ill-bred it is!
author: Catullus

quote: This strange disease of modern life  with its sick hurry  its divided aims.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: The illusion that times that were are better than those that are has probably pervaded all ages.
author: Horace Greeley

quote: Oh  what times! Oh  what standards!
author: Cicero

quote: Probably no one alive hasn't at one time or another brooded over the possibility of going back to an earlier  ideal age in his existence and living a different kind of life.
author: Hal Boyle

quote: The Golden Age was never the present Age.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: The worst time is always the present.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: The "good old times"-all times  when old  are good.
author: Lord Byron

quote: "The good old days." The only good days are ahead.
author: Alice Childress

quote: There are two kinds of stones  as everyone knows  one which rolls.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: Recognizing what we have done in the past is a recognition of ourselves. By conducting a dialogue with our past  we are searching how to go forward.
author: Kiyoko Takeda

quote: I know of no way of judging the future but by the past.
author: Patrick Henry

quote: Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it.
author: George Santayana

quote: To look backward for a while is to refresh the eye  to restore it  and to render it more fit for its prime function of looking forward.
author: Margaret Fairless Barber

quote: The past is never dead-it is not even past.
author: William Faulkner

quote: The past is the best way to suppose what may come.
author: Lord Halifax

quote: We can never go back again  that much is certain. The past is still too close to us. The things we have tried to forget and put behind us would stir again  and that sense of fear  of furtive unrest... might in some manner unforeseen become a living companion  as it had before.
author: Daphne du Maurier

quote: Past: Our cradle  not our prison  and there is danger as well as appeal in its glamour. The past is for inspiration  not imitation  for continuation  not repetition.
author: Israel Zangwill

quote: Life can only be understood backwards  but it must be lived forward.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: When I want to understand what is happening today or try to decide what will happen tomorrow  I look back.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: We live in the present  we dream of the future  but we learn eternal truths from the past.
author: Madame Chiang Kai-Shek

quote: The past is the best prophet of the future.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Truth  however bitter  can be accepted  and woven into a design for living.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: The past will not tell us what we ought to do  but... what we ought to avoid.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: Tomorrow hopes we have learned something from yesterday.
author: John Wayne

quote: Judgement comes from experience  and great judgement comes from bad experience.
author: Robert Packwood

quote: The only use of a knowledge of the past is to equip us for the present.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: When the past has taught us that we have more within us than we have ever used  our prayer is a cry to the divine to come to us and fill us with its power.
author: Rudolph Steiner

quote: Don't ruin the present with the ruined past.
author: Ellen Gilchrist

quote: Ah tell me not that memory Sheds gladness o'er the past  What is recalled by faded flowers Save that they did not last?
author: Letitia Landon

quote: Here lies my past  Goodbye I have kissed it  Thank you kids  I wouldn't have missed it.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: Forget the past and live the present hour.
author: Sarah Knowles Bolton

quote: Living in the past is a dull and lonely business  looking back strains the neck muscles  causes you to bump into people not going your way.
author: Edna Ferber

quote: I demolish my bridges behind me ... then there is no choice but forward.
author: Firdtjof Nansen

quote: Looking repeatedly into the past  you do not necessarily become fascinated with your own life  but rather with the phenomenon of memory.
author: Patricia Hampl

quote: Let the past drift away with the water.
author: Japanese saying

quote: The past cannot be changed. The future is yet in your power.
author: Mary Pickford

quote: I have very strong feelings about how you lead your life. You always look ahead  you never look back.
author: Ann Richards

quote: Not the power to remember  but its very opposite  the power to forget  is a necessary condition for our existence.
author: Sholem Asch

quote: You cannot step twice into the same river  for other waters are continually flowing on.
author: Heraclitus

quote: Better by far you should forget and smile  than that you should remember and be sad.
author: Christina Rossetti

quote: The past should be culled like a box of fresh strawberries  rinsed of debris  sweetened judiciously and served in small portions  not very often.
author: Laura Palmer

quote: May I forget what ought to be forgotten  and recall  unfailing  all that ought to be recalled  each kindly thing  forgetting what might sting.
author: Maty Caroline Davies

quote: One must be thrust out of a finished cycle in life  and that leap is the most difficult to make-to part with one's faith  one's love  when one would prefer to renew the faith and recreate the passion.
author: Anais Nin

quote: The biggest thing in today's sorrow is the memory of yesterday's joy.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: It's but little good you'll go a-water-ing the last year's crop.
author: George Eliot

quote: The worst thing you can do is to try to cling to something that's gone  or to recreate it.
author: Johnette Napolitano

quote: Ne'er look for the birds of this year in the nests of the last.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Don't look back. Something may be gaining on you.
author: Satchel Paige

quote: Anyone who limits her vision to memories of yesterday is already dead.
author: Lillie Langtry

quote: I like the dreams for the future better than the history of the past.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The first recipe for happiness is: Avoid too lengthy meditations on the past.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: The past is a funeral gone by.
author: Edmund Gosse

quote: Never let yesterday use up today.
author: Richard H. Nelson

quote: How the past perishes is how the future becomes.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: The dogmas of the quiet past are inadequate to the stormy present.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: In the life of the spirit there is no ending that is not a beginning.
author: Henrietta Zolde

quote: The past is but the beginning of a beginning  and all that is and has been is but the twilight of the dawn.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: Anyone who limits her vision to memories of yesterday is already dead.
author: Lillie Langtry

quote: Nor deem the irrevocable Past As wholly wasted  wholly vain  If  rising on its wrecks  at last To something nobler we attain.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Youth is  after all  just a moment  but it is the moment  the spark that you always carry in your heart.
author: Raisa M. Gorbachev

quote: Nothing is predestined: The obstacles of your past can become the gateways that lead to new beginnings.
author: Ralph Blum

quote: No star is ever lost we once have seen  We always may be what we might have been.
author: Adelaide Proctor

quote: In my end is my beginning.
author: Mary Stuart

quote: The good old days were never that good  believe me. The good new days are today  and better days are coming tomorrow. Our greatest songs are still unsung.
author: Hubert H. Humphrey

quote: The past is never completely lost  khowever extensive the devastation. Your sorrows are the bricks and mortar of a magnificent temple. What you are today and what you will be tomorrow are because of what you have been.
author: Gordon Wright

quote: Fear not for the future  weep not for the past.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: There are two days about which nobody should ever worry  and these are yesterday and tomorrow.
author: Robert Jones Burdette

quote: We crucify ourselves between two thieves: regret for yesterday and fear of tomorrow.
author: Fulton Oursler

quote: I'm not convinced that the world is in any worse shape than it ever was. It's just that in this age of almost instantaneous communication  we bear the weight of problems our forefathers only read about after they were solved.
author: Burton Hillis

quote: Truth has no beginning.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: The world's history is constant  like the laws of nature  and simple  like the souls of men.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: These are the stories that never  never die  that are carried like seed into a new country  are told to you and me and make in us new and lasting strengths.
author: Meridel Le Sueur

quote: What one loves in childhood stays in the heart forever.
author: Mary Jo Putney

quote: In times like these  it helps to recall that there have always been times like these.
author: Paul Harvey

quote: Our ignorance of history makes us libel our own times. People have always been like this.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: The good old days are neither better nor worse than the ones we're living through right now.
author: Artie Shaw

quote: Where I was born and where and how I have lived is unimportant. It is what I have done with where I have been that should be of interest.
author: Georgia O'Keeffe

quote: Respect the past in the full measure of its deserts  but do not make the mistake of confusing it with the present  nor seek in it the ideals of the future.
author: Jose Ingenieros

quote: It's a pleasure to share one's memories. Everything remembered is dear  endearing  touching  precious. At least the past is safe-though we didn't know it at the time. We know it now. Because it's in the past  because we have survived.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: The events in our lives happen in a sequence in time  but in their significance to ourselves  they find their own order ... the continuous thread of revelation.
author: Eudora Welty

quote: The best compliment we can pay our past is to prophetically and bravely face today and tomorrow.
author: Bernie Wiebe

quote: Some memories are realities  and are better than anything that can ever happen to one again.
author: Willa Cather

quote: Fortunate are the people whose roots are deep.
author: Agnes Meyer

quote: As the dew to the blossom  the bud to the bee  As the scent to the rose  are those memories to me.
author: Amelia C. Welby

quote: Heirlooms we don't have in our family. But stories we've got.
author: Rose Chernin

quote: We have to do with the past only as we can make it useful to the present and the future.
author: Frederick Douglass

quote: The past is a guidepost  not a hitching post.
author: L. Thomas Holdcroft

quote: The past in retrospect holds manifold disenchantments  failures and even tragedies  and yet the worse may be forgotten and the best held fast.
author: W. Robertson Neicoll

quote: The road was new to me  as roads always are  going back.
author: Sarah Orne Jewett

quote: No yesterdays are ever wasted for those who give themselves to today.
author: Brendan Francis

quote: Yesterday I lived  today I suffer  tomorrow I die  but I still think fondly  today and tomorrow  of yesterday.
author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing

quote: Each has his past shut in him like the leaves of a book shown to him by heart  and his friends can only read the title.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: We are well advised to keep on nodding terms with the people we used to be  whether we find them attractive company or not.... We forget all too soon the things we thought we could never forget.
author: Joan Didion

quote: The past is a work of art  free of irrelevancies and loose ends.
author: Max Beerbohm

quote: The past is a foreign country  they do things differently there.
author: Leslie Poles Hartley

quote: The past with its pleasures  its rewards  its foolishness  its punishments  is there for each of us forever  and it should be.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: The past is that which we possess fully and in whole.
author: Isidor Eliashev

quote: Our deeds still travel with us from afar  and what we have been makes us what we are.
author: George Eliot

quote: The past is the tomorrow that got away.
author: Leonard L. Levinson

quote: Our life is like some vast lake that is slowly filling with the stream of our years. As the waters creep surely upward the landmarks of the past are one by one submerged. But there shall always be memory to lift its head above the tide until the lake is overflowing.
author: Alexandre Charles Auguste Bisson

quote: No past is dead for us  but only sleeping  love.
author: Helen Hunt Jackson

quote: I look back on my life like a good day's work  it is done and I am satisfied with it.
author: Grandma Moses

quote: Of all sad words of tongue or pen  the saddest are these: It might have been.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: That sign of old age  extolling the past at the expense of the present.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: The past is one evil less and one memory more.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: The past not merely is not fugitive  it remains present.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: The past which is so presumptuously brought forward as a precedent for the present was itself founded on some past that went before it.
author: Madame de Stael

quote: "Old times" never come back and I suppose it's just as well. What comes back is a new morning every day in the year  and that's better.
author: George E. Woodberry

quote: We have inherited new difficulties because we have inherited more privileges.
author: Dr. Abram Sacher

quote: People are always asking about the good old days. I say  why don't you say the good "now" days? Isn't "now" the only time you're living?
author: Robert M. Young

quote: Life in the twentieth century undeniably has ... such richness  joy and adventure as were unknown to our ancestors except in their dreams.
author: Arthur H. Campton

quote: The past is our very being.
author: David Ben-Gurion

quote: To disdain today is to prove that yesterday has been misunderstood.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: The universe is made of stories  not of atoms.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: This is not a dress rehearsal. This is It.
author: Tom Cunningham

quote: Only when your consciousness is totally focused on the moment you are in can you receive whatever gift  esson  or delight that moment has to
author: Barbara De Angelis

quote: Seize the day  and put the least possible trust in tomorrow.
author: Horace

quote: Tomorrow's life is too late. Live today.
author: Martial

quote: One today is worth two tomorrows.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Half of today is better than all of tomorrow.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: Today is the first day of the rest of your life.
author: Abbie Hoffman

quote: The present moment is significant  not as the bridge between past and future  but by reason of its contents  which can fill our emptiness and become ours  if we are capable of receiving them
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: All of us tend to put off living. We are all dreaming of some magical rose garden over the horizon instead of enjoying the roses that are blooming outside our windows today.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: It's not that "today is the first day of the rest of my life " but that now is all there is of my life.
author: Hugh Prather

quote: We want to live in the present  and the only history that is worth a tinker's damn is the history we make today.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Enjoy yourself  drink  call the life you live today your own-but only that  the rest belongs to chance.
author: Euripides

quote: If we are ever to enjoy life  now is the time  not tomorrow or next year. ... Today should always be our most wonderful day.
author: Thomas Dreier

quote: Live now  believe me  wait not till tomorrow  gather the roses of life today.
author: Pierre de Ronsard

quote: So often we rob tomorrow's memories by today's economies.
author: John Mason Brown

quote: You had better live your best and act your best and think your best today  for today is the sure preparation for tomorrow and all the other tomorrows that follow.
author: Harriet Martineau

quote: Happy the man  and happy he alone He can call today his own. He who  secure within can say  "Tomorrow  do thy worst  for I have lived today."
author: Henry Fielding

quote: Forget mistakes. Forget failures. Forget everything except what you're going to do now and do it. Today is your lucky day.
author: Will Durant

quote: Yesterday is ashes  tomorrow wood. Only today does the fire burn brightly.
author: Old Eskimo proverb

quote: One of these days is none of these days.
author: H. G. Bohn

quote: He growled at morning  noon  and night  And trouble sought to borrow  Although today the sky was bright  He knew t'would storm tomorrow  A thought of joy he could not stand  And struggled to resist it  Though sunshine dappled all the land This sorry pessimist it.
author: Nixon Waterman

quote: To those leaning on the sustaining infinite  to-day is big with blessings.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: The here-and-now is no mere filling of time  but a filling of time with God.
author: John Foster

quote: In the present  every day is a miracle.
author: James Gould Cozzens

quote: Life is only this place  this time  and these people right here and now.
author: Vincent Collins

quote: I believe that only one person in a thousand knows the trick of really living in the present.
author: Storm Jameson
