quote: There is but an hour a day between a good housewife and a bad one.
author: English proverb

quote: If a woman likes another woman  she's cordial. If she doesn't like her  she's very cordial.
author: Irvin S. Cobb

quote: Next to the wound  what women make best is the bandage.
author: Barbey d'Aurevilly

quote: Social science affirms that a woman's place in society marks the level of civilization.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quote: Nobody objects to a woman being a good writer or sculptor or geneticist if at the same time she manages to be a good wife  good mother  good looking  good tempered  well groomed and unaggressive.
author: Leslie M. Mclntyre

quote: It was a woman who drove me to drink - and  you know  I never even thanked her.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: Each suburban housewife spends her time presiding over a power plant sufficient to have staffed the palace of a Roman emperor with a hundred slaves.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: Boys don't make passes at female smart-asses.
author: Letty Cottin Pogrebin

quote: As a woman  to be competitive is to be passive.
author: Marianne Partridge

quote: Women are like elephants. They are interesting to look at  but I wouldn't like to own one.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: No woman can call herself free who does not own and control her body. No woman can call herself free until she can choose consciously whether she will or will not be a mother.
author: Margaret Sanger

quote: Women are most adorable when they are afraid  that's why they frighten so easily.
author: Ludwig Borne

quote: Can we today measure devotion to husband and children by our indifference to everything else?
author: Golda Meir

quote: Women are perfectly well aware that the more they seem to obey the more they rule.
author: Jules Michelet

quote: What will not woman  gentle woman dare When strong affection stirs her spirit up?
author: Robert Southey

quote: Women keep a special corner of their hearts for sins they have never committed.
author: Cornelia Otis Skinner

quote: Nature is in earnest when she makes a woman.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: The only question left to be settled now is  are women persons?
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Women do not find it difficult nowadays to behave like men  but they often find it extremely difficult to behave like gentlemen.
author: Compton Mackenzie

quote: When a woman dressjBS up for an occasion  the man should become the black velvet pillow for the jewel.
author: John Weitz

quote: Woman's place is in the wrong.
author: James Thurber

quote: There are no ugly women  only lazy ones.
author: Helena Rubinstein

quote: A woman without a man is like a fish without a bicycle.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: I dress for women - and I undress for men.
author: Angle Dickinson

quote: She was not a woman likely to settle for equality when sex gave her an advantage.
author: Anthony Delano

quote: Whether they give or refuse  women are glad to have been asked.
author: Ovid

quote: One can find women who have never had a love affair  but it is rare indeed to find any who have had only one.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: The mirror is the conscience of women  they never do a thing without first consulting it.
author: Morltz G. Saphlr

quote: Simpson succeeded in proving that there was no harm in giving anaesthetics to men  because God put Adam into a deep sleep when He extracted his rib. But male ecclesiastics remained unconvinced as regards the sufferings of women  at any rate in childbirth.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Women who set a low value on themselves make life hard for all women.
author: Nellie McClung

quote: Women have simple tastes. They get pleasure out of the conversation of children in arms and men in love.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Women are the cowards they are because they have been semi-slaves for so long. The number of women prepared to stand up for what they really think  feel  experience  with a man they are in love with is still very small.
author: Doris Lessing

quote: Woman's normal occupations in general run counter to creative life  or contemplative life  or saintly life.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: If woman had no existence save in the fiction written by men  one would imagine her a person of the utmost importance  very various  heroic and mean  splendid and sordid  infinitely beautiful and hideous in the extreme  as great as a man  some think even better.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: No man is as anti-feminist as a really feminine woman.
author: Frank O'Connor

quote: The ideal woman which is in every man's mind is evoked by a word or phrase or the shape of her wrist  her hand. The most beautiful description of a woman is by understatement. Remember  all Tolstoy ever said to describe Anna Karenina was that she was beautiful and could see in the dark like a cat. Every man has a different idea of what's beautiful  and it's best to take the gesture  the shadow of the branch  and let the mind create the tree.
author: William Faulkner

quote: The study of women's intelligence and personality has had broadly the same history as the one we record for Negroes ... in drawing a parallel between the position of  and feeling toward  women and Negroes  we are uncovering a fundamental basis of our culture.
author: Gunnar Myrdal

quote: Women always have some mental reservation.
author: Louis Ferdinand Destouches

quote: You see  dear  it is not true that woman was made from man's rib  she was really made from his funny bone.
author: Sir James Matthew Barrie

quote: In her first passion woman loves her lover  In all the others  all she loves is love.
author: Lord Byron

quote: A woman is like your shadow  follow her  she flies  fly from her  she follows.
author: Sebastien Chamfort

quote: Heaven has no rage like love to hatred turned  Nor hell a fury like a woman scorned.
author: William Congreve

quote: But what is woman? Only one of nature's agreeable blunders.
author: Abraham Cowley

quote: Men say of women what pleases them! women do with men what pleases them.
author: De Segur

quote: Cbercbez lafemme. (Find the woman.)
author: Alexander Dumas

quote: There is no worse evil than a bad woman  and nothing has ever been produced better than a good one.
author: Euripides

quote: The society of women is the foundation of good manners.
author: Goethe

quote: Most men who run down women are running down one woman only.
author: Remy de Gourmont

quote: Women forgive injuries  but never forget slights.
author: Thomas Haliburton

quote: The crown of creation.
author: Herdeb

quote: Man has his will  - but woman has her way.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: It is God who makes woman beautiful  it is the devil who makes her pretty.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: A woman's guess is much more accurate than a man's certainty.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: An' I learned about women from 'er.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: The colonel's lady and Judy O'Grady Are sisters under their skins.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: For the female of the species is more deadly than the male.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: A rag and a bone and a hank of hair.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: There are no ugly women  there are only women who do not know how to look pretty.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: Earth's noblest thing  a Woman perfected.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: The great fault in women is to desire to be like men.
author: De Maistre

quote: Too fair to worship  too divine to love.
author: Henry Hart Milman

quote: Grace was in all her steps  heaven in her eye  In every gesture dignity and love.
author: John Milton

quote: Offend her  and she knows not to forgive  Oblige her  and she'll hate you while you live.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Woman's at best a contradiction still.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: O wild  dark flower of woman  Deep rose of my desire  An Eastern wizard made you Of earth and stars and fire.
author: C. G. D. Roberts

quote: It is easier for a woman to defend her virtue against men than her reputation against women.
author: Rochebrune

quote: Such  Polly  are your sex - part truth  part fiction  Some thought  much whim  and all contradiction.
author: Richard Savage

quote: Honor women! they entwine and weave heavenly roses in our earthly life.
author: Friedrich von Schiller

quote: The weakness of their reasoning faculty also explains why women show more sympathy for the unfortunate than men ... and why  on the contrary  they are inferior to men as regards justice  and less honourable and conscientious.
author: Schopenhauer

quote: O Woman! in our hours of ease  Uncertain coy  and hard to please  And variable as the shade By the light quivering aspen made  When pain and anguish wring the brow  A ministering angel thou!
author: Walter Scott

quote: In the beginning  said a Persian poet - Allah took a rose  a lily  a dove  a serpent  a little honey  a Dead Sea apple  and a handful of clay. When he looked at the amalgram -  it was a woman.
author: William Sharp

quote: A woman either loves or hates: she knows no medium.
author: Syrus

quote: Regard the society of women as a necessary unpleasantness of social life  and avoid it as much as possible.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: She was a Phantom of delight When first she gleamed upon my sight  A lovely Apparition  sent To be a moment's ornament.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Action springs not from thought  but from a readiness for responsibility.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quote: What you can do  or dream you can do  begin it  boldness has genius  power and magic in it.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: There are people who put their dreams in a little box and say  "Yes  I've got dreams  of course  I've got dreams." Then they put the box away and bring it out once in a while to look in it  and yep  they're still there. These are great dreams  but they never even get out of the box. It takes an uncommon amount of guts to put your dreams on the line  to hold them up and say  "How good or how bad am I?" That's where courage comes in.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: The difference between getting somewhere and nowhere is the courage to make an early start.
author: Charles M. Schwab

quote: How many feasible projects have miscarried through despondency  and been strangled in their birth by a cowardly imagination?
author: Jeremy Collier

quote: Courage to start and willingness to keep everlasting at it are the requisites for success.
author: Alonzo Newton Benn

quote: There is no such thing as a long piece of work  except one that you dare not start.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: To the timid and hesitating everything is impossible because it seems so.
author: Sir Walter Scott

quote: He who begun has half done. Dare to be wise  begin.
author: Horace

quote: It's weak and despicable to go on wanting things and not trying to get them.
author: Joanna Field

quote: When it comes to betting on yourself ... you're a chicken-livered coward if you hesitate.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: Imposing limitations on yourself is cowardly because it protects you from having to try  and perhaps failing.
author: Vladimir Zworykin

quote: All know the way  few actually walk it.
author: Bodhidharma

quote: The distance doesn't matter  only the first step is difficult.
author: Madame Marquise du Deffand

quote: Seize opportunity by the beard  for it is bald behind.
author: Bulgarian proverb

quote: Procrastination usually results in sorrowful regret. Today's duties put off until tomorrow give us a double burden to bear  the best way is to do them in their proper time.
author: Ida Scott Taylor

quote: If you dam a river it stagnates. Running water is beautiful water.
author: English proverb

quote: Never mistake motion for action.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: A person who has not done one half his day's work by ten o' clock  runs a chance of leaving the other half undone.
author: Emily Bronte

quote: There is clearly much left to be done  and whatever else we are going to do  we had better get on with it.
author: Rosalynn Carter

quote: Procrastination is the thief of time.
author: Edward Young

quote: Slaying the dragon of delay is no sport for the short-winded.
author: Sandra Day O'Connor

quote: If a man would move the world  he must first move himself.
author: Socrates

quote: Who hesitate and falter life away  and lose tomorrow the ground won today.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: Now or never was the time.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: Can anything be sadder than work unfinished? Yes  work never begun.
author: Christina Rossetti

quote: Fear not that thy life shall come to an end  but rather that it shall never have a beginning.
author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

quote: Go ahead with your life  your plans.... Don't waste time by stopping before the interruptions have started.
author: Richard L. Evans

quote: A hard beginning makes a good ending.
author: John Heywood

quote: We may our ends by our beginnings know.
author: Sir John Denham

quote: The only joy in the world is to begin.
author: Cesare Pavese

quote: The best way to prepare for life is to begin to live.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: A schoolboy's tale  the wonder of an hour!
author: Lord Byron

quote: Wonder is the basis of worship.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: No wonder can last more than three days.
author: Italian proverb

quote: Come live in my heart and pay no rent.
author: Samuel Lover

quote: There is a tide in the affairs of women Which  taken at the flood  leads - God knows where.
author: Lord Byron

quote: "Yes " I answered you last night  "No " this morning  sir  I say: Colors seen by candle-light Will not look the same by day.
author: E. B. Browning

quote: And let us mind  faint heart ne'er wan A lady fair.
author: James Drummond Burns

quote: Tis enough -  Who listens once will listen twice  Her heart be sure is not of ice  And one refusal no rebuff.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Never wedding  ever wooing  Still a lovelorn heart pursuing  Read you not the wrong you're doing In my cheek's pale hue? All my life with sorrow strewing  Wed or cease to woo.
author: Thomas Campbell

quote: If I am not worth the wooing  I surely am not worth the winning.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Thrice happy's the wooing that's not long a-doing  So much time is saved in the billing and cooing.
author: R. H. Barham

quote: Why don't you speak for yourself  John?
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Perhaps if you address the lady Most politely  most politely  Flatter and impress the lady Most politely  most politely  Humbly beg and humbly sue  She may deign to look on you.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: The time I've lost in wooing  In watching and pursuing The light that lies In woman's eyes  Has been my heart's undoing.
author: George Moore

quote: They dream in courtship  but in wedlock wake.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: A fool there was and he made his prayer (Even as you and I!) To a rag and a bone and a hank of hair (We called her the woman who did not care) But the fool he called her his lady fair -  (Even as you or I!)
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: The way of an eagle in the air  the way of a serpent upon a rock  the way of a ship in the midst of the sea  and the way of a man with a maid.
author: Proverbs

quote: Words of affection  howsoe'er expressed  The latest spoken still are deem'd the best.
author: Joanna Baillie

quote: A very great part of the mischiefs that vex this world arises from words.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Words writ in waters.
author: George Chapman

quote: Fair words butter no parsnips.
author: John Clarke

quote: Mum is the word.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Words that weep  and tears that speak.
author: Abraham Cowley

quote: But words once spoke can never be recall'd.
author: Wentworth Dillon

quote: Our words have wings  but fly not where we would.
author: George Eliot

quote: Words are feminine  deeds are masculine.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: Words are the most powerful drug used by mankind.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: We should have a great many fewer disputes in the world if words were taken for what they are  the signs of our ideas only  and not for things themselves.
author: John Locke

quote: Speaking words of endearment where words of comfort availed not.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Sticks and stones may break my bones  But words can never harm me.
author: Old English Rhyme

quote: Words will build no walls.
author: Plutarch

quote: A word spoken in good season  how good it is!
author: Proverbs

quote: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.
author: Proverbs

quote: One of our defects as a nation is a tendency to use what have been called "weasel words." When a weasel sucks eggs the meat is sucked out of the egg. If you use a "weasel word" after another there is nothing left of the other.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: A word to the wise is sufficient.
author: Terence

quote: Man does not live by words alone  despite the fact that sometimes he has to eat them.
author: Adlai Stevenson

quote: I sometimes hold it half a sin To put in words the grief I feel  For words  like Nature  half reveal And half conceal the Soul within.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: He utters empty words  he utters sound without mind.
author: Virgil

quote: You (Pindar) who possessed the talent of speaking much without saying anything.
author: Voltaire

quote: For of all sad words of tongue or pen  The saddest are these: "It might have been!"
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: 'twas bryllig and the slithy toves Did gyre and gimble in the wabe  All mimsy were the borogoves  And the mome raths out grabe.
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: A word is not the same with one writer as with another. One tears it from his guts. The other pulls it out of his overcoat pocket.
author: Charles Peguy

quote: Language is the Rubicon that divides man from beast.
author: Max Miiller

quote: Dialect words - those terrible marks of the beast to the truly genteel.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: Eloquence is the language of nature  and cannot be learned in the schools  but rhetoric is the creature of art  which he who feels least will most excel in.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: For words  like Nature  half reveal And half conceal the Soul within.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: If you were to make little fishes talk  they would talk like whales.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: Letter-writing is the only device for combining solitude with good company.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Man is a creature who lives not upon bread alone  but principally by catch words.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Many terms which have now dropped out of favour will be revived  and those that are at present respectable  will drop out  if useage so choose with whom resides the decision and the judgment and the code of speech.
author: Horace

quote: Numbers constitute the only universal language.
author: Nathanael West

quote: Soft words are hard arguments.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Thanks to words  we have been able to rise above the brutes  and thanks to words  we have often sunk to the level of the demons.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The adjective is the banana peel of the parts of speech.
author: Clifton Fadiman

quote: The limits of my language are the limits of my mind. All I know is what I have words for.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: The art of translation lies less in knowing the other language than in knowing your own.
author: Ned Rorem

quote: The two most beautiful words in the English language are "cheque enclosed".
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: The medium is the message.
author: Marshall McLuhan

quote: The stroke of the whip maketh marks in the flesh  but the stroke of the tongue breaketh the bones. Many have fallen by the edge of the sword  but not so many as have fallen by the tongue.
author: Ecclesiasticus

quote: The thoughtless are rarely wordless.
author: Howard W. Newton

quote: We must have a better word than "prefabricated"  why not "ready-made"?
author: Winston Churchill

quote: We must think things not words  or at least we must constantly translate our words into the facts for which they stand  if we are to keep to the real and the true.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Words are the small change of thought.
author: Jules Renard

quote: Words should be weighed and not counted.
author: Yiddish proverb

quote: Since the concepts people live by are derived only from perceptions and from language and since the perceptions are received and interpreted only in light of earlier concepts  man comes pretty close to living in a house that language built.
author: Russell R. W. Smith

quote: If a conceptual distinction is to be made  the machinery for making it ought to show itself in language. If a distinction cannot be made in language  it cannot be made conceptually.
author: N. R. Hanson

quote: Often I am struck in amazement about a word: I suddenly realize that the complete arbitrariness of our language is but a part of the arbitrariness of our own world in general.
author: Christian Morgenstern

quote: Understanding is nothing else than conception caused by speech.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: Language is to the mind more than light is to the eye.
author: William Gibson

quote: Who does not know another language  does not know his own.
author: Goethe

quote: To me  the term 'middle-class' connotes a safe  comfortable  middle-of-the road policy. Above all  our language is 'middle-class' in the middle of our road. To drive it to one side or the other or even off the road  is the noblest task of the future.
author: Christian Morgenstern

quote: Similes are like songs of love: They much describe  they nothing prove.
author: Matthew Prior

quote: Words are the physicians of a mind diseased.
author: Aeschylus

quote: A language is a dialect with its own army and navy.
author: Max Weinreich

quote: 'When I use a word ' Humpty Dumpty said in rather a scornful tone  'it means just what I choose it to mean - neither more nor less.' 'The question is ' said Alice  'whether you can make words mean so many different things.' 'The question is ' said Humpty Dumpty  'which is to be master - that's all.'
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: The word is half his that speaks  and half his that hears it.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: A single word often betrays a great design.
author: Jean Baptiste Racine

quote: Words once spoken  can never be recalled.
author: Wentworth Dillon

quote: Some words are like the old Roman galleys  large-scaled and ponderous. They sit low in the water even when their cargo is light.
author: William Jovanovich

quote: It's as interesting and as difficult to say a thing well as to paint it. There is the art of lines and colours  but the art of words exists too  and will never be less important.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: Words  like eyeglasses  blur everything that they do not make clear.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: There is only one way to degrade mankind permanently and that is to destroy language.
author: Northrop Frye

quote: The art of writing is the art of discovering what you believe.
author: David Hare

quote: The limits of my language mean the limits of my world.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: More than kisses  letters mingle souls.
author: John Donne

quote: I wonder what language truck drivers are using  now that everyone is using theirs?
author: Beryl Pfizer

quote: The two words 'information' and 'communication' are often used interchangeably  but they signify quite different things. Information is giving out  communication is getting through.
author: Sydney J. Harris

quote: The Englishman loves to roll his tongue around the word  'extraordinary'. It so pleases him that he is reluctant to finish the sound which goes on into harmonics and overtones. The North American publisher is likewise inclined.
author: R. I. Fitzhenry

quote: Words are feminine  deeds are masculine.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: Let it not be said that I have said nothing new. The arrangement of the material is new.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: When an idea is wanting  a word can always be found to take its place.
author: Goethe

quote: Speech is civilization itself. The word  even the most contradictory word  preserves contact - it is silence which isolates.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: Like stones  words are laborious and unforgiving  and the fitting of them together  like the fitting of stones  demands great patience and strength of purpose and particular skill.
author: Edmund Morrison

quote: Great literature is simply language charged with meaning to the utmost possible degree.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: One way of looking at speech is to say it is a constant stratagem to cover nakedness.
author: Harold Pinter

quote: The downtrodden  who are the great creators of slang  hurl pithiness and colour at poverty and oppression.
author: Anthony Burgess

quote: Slang is language which takes off its coat  spits on its hands - and goes to work.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Man's command of the language is most important. Next to kissing  it's the most exciting form of communication.
author: Oren Arnold

quote: "Plain English" - everybody loves it  demands it - from the other fellow.
author: Jacques Barzun

quote: Words are as recalcitrant as circus animals  and the unskilled trainer can crack his whip at them in vain.
author: Gerald Brenan

quote: The magic of the tongue is the most dangerous of all spells.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: A word after a word after a word is power.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: You have to fall in love with hanging around words.
author: John Ciardi

quote: Language is the armoury of the human mind  and at once contains the trophies of its past  and the weapons of its future conquests.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: Everyone hears only what he understands.
author: Goethe

quote: When I feel inclined to read poetry  I take down my dictionary. The poetry of words is quite as beautiful as the poetry of sentences.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Language most shows a man  speak that I may see thee.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: True eloquence consists of saying all that should be  not all that could be  said.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: Even if language is a living evolving organism  we don't have to embrace all the changes that occur during our lifetimes. If language is so alive  it can get sick.
author: Christopher Lehmann-Haupt

quote: Our language  one of our most precious natural resources  deserves at least as much protection as our woodlands  streams and whooping cranes.
author: James Lipton

quote: Language is an inventory of human experience.
author: L. W. Lockhart

quote: Change is legitimate and inevitable  for our language is a mighty river  picking up silt and flotsam here and discarding it there  but growing ever wider and richer.
author: Robert MacNeil

quote: The grossest thing in our gross national product today is our language. It is suffering from inflation.
author: James Reston

quote: A word has its use  Or  like a man  it will soon have a grave.
author: Edward Arlington Robinson

quote: No matter how eloquently a dog may bark  he cannot tell you that his parents were poor but honest.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Most people have to talk so they won't hear.
author: May Sarton

quote: Every utterance is an event  and no two events are precisely alike. The extreme view  therefore  is that no word ever means the same thing twice.
author: Louis B. Saloman

quote: It is with words as with sunbeams. The more they are condensed  the deeper they burn.
author: Robert Southey

quote: If you can teach me a new word  I'll walk all the way to China to get it.
author: Turkish proverb

quote: I have always suspected that correctness is the last refuge of those who have nothing to say.
author: Friedrich Wasiman

quote: By working faithfully eight hours a day you may eventually get to be a boss and work 12 hours a day.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Everything considered  work is less boring than amusing oneself.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: A windmill is eternally at work to accomplish one end  although it shifts with every variation of the weather cock  and assumes 10 different positions in a day.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: A good horse should be seldom spurred.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: All work is seed sown. It grows and spreads  and sows itself anew.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Chop your own wood and it will warm you twice.
author: Fairlane

quote: Give the labourer his wage before his perspiration be dry.
author: Muhammad

quote: I want a house that has gotten over all its troubles  I don't want to spend the rest of my life bringing up a young and inexperienced house.
author: Jerome K. Jerome

quote: If you want a work well done  select a busy man: the other kind has no time.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: It is impossible to enjoy idling thoroughly unless one has plenty of work to do.
author: Jerome K. Jerome

quote: Most people work the greater part of their time for a mere living  and the little freedom which remains to them so troubles them that they use every means of getting rid of it.
author: Goethe

quote: Neither snow  nor rain  nor heat  nor gloom of night stay these couriers from the swift completion of their appointed rounds.
author: Herodotus

quote: No fine work can be done without concentration and self-sacrifice and toil and doubt.
author: Max Beerbohm

quote: No task  rightly done is truly private. It is part of the world's work.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: One of the saddest things is  the only thing a man can do for 8 hours a day  day after day  is work. You can't eat 8 hours a day nor drink for 8 hours a day  nor make love for 8 hours.
author: William Faulkner

quote: The only place where success comes before work is a dictionary.
author: Vidal Sassoon

quote: Routine is the god of every social system  it is the seventh heaven of business  the essential component in the success of every factory  the ideal of every statesman.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: The monarchy is a labour-intensive industry.
author: Harold Wilson

quote: The test of a vocation is the love of the drudgery it involves.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: They say hard work never hurt anybody  but I figure why take the chance.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: Unionism  seldom if ever  uses such powers as it has to ensure better work  almost always it devotes a large part of that power to safeguarding bad work.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Work is of two kinds: first  altering a position of matter at or near the earth's surface relatively to other such matter  second  telling other people to do so. The first kind is unpleasant and ill-paid  the second is pleasant and highly paid.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: As a remedy against all ills - poverty  sickness  and melanchol - only one thing is absolutely necessary: a liking for work.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: They intoxicate themselves with work so they won't see how they really are.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Most people like hard work  particularly when they're paying for it.
author: Franklin P. Jones

quote: We work to become  not to acquire.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: If one defines the term 'dropout' to mean a person who has given up serious effort to meet his responsibilities  then every business office  government agency  golf club and university faculty would yield its quota.
author: John W. Gardner

quote: Hasten slowly  and without losing heart  put your work twenty times upon the anvil.
author: Nicolas Boileau

quote: How many years of fatigue and punishment it takes to learn the simple truth that work  that disagreeable thing  is the only way of not suffering in life  or at all events  of suffering less.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Miracles sometimes occur  but one has to work terribly hard for them.
author: Chaim Weizmann

quote: Employment is nature's physician  and is essential to human happiness.
author: Galen

quote: Work is the grand cure of all the maladies and miseries that ever beset mankind.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Chance favours only those who know how to court her.
author: Charles Nicolle

quote: Work is man's most natural form of relaxation.
author: Dagobert Runes

quote: Work is not man's punishment. It is his reward and his strength  his glory and his pleasure.
author: George Sand

quote: If a man loves the labour of his trade  apart from any question of success or fame  the gods have called him.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: When white-collar people get jobs  they sell not only their time and energy  but their personalities as well. They sell by week  or month  their smiles and their kindly gestures  and they must practise prompt repression of resentment and aggression.
author: C. Wright Mills

quote: He that can work is a born king of something.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Love of bustle is not industry.
author: Seneca

quote: The joy about our work is spoiled when we perform it not because of what we produce but because of the pleasure with which it can provide us  or the pain against which it can protect us.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: Productive work is the central purpose of a rational man's life  the central value that integrates and determines the hierarchy of all his other values. Reason is the source  the precondition of his productive work - pride is the result.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: By the work one knows the workman.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: Because it is less structured than work  leisure time leaves workaholics at a loss for what to do. Workaholics practically climb the wall when they can't work.
author: Marilyn Machlowitz

quote: Workaholics commit slow suicide by refusing to allow the child inside them to play.
author: Dr. Laurence Susser

quote: Man works primarily for his own self-respect and not for others or for profit. . . the person who is working for the sake of his own satisfaction  the money he gets in return serves merely as fuel  that is  as a symbol of reward and recognition  in the last analysis  of acceptance by one's fellowmen.
author: Otto Rank

quote: To travel hopefully is a better thing than to arrive  and the true success is to labour.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: In a professional once engaged  the performance of the job comes first.
author: Garson Kanin

quote: If a little labour  little are our gains. Man's fortunes are according to his pains.
author: Robert Herrick

quote: A man must love a thing very much if he not only practises it without any hope of fame and money  but even practises it without any hope of doing it well.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: A task becomes a duty from the moment you suspect it to be an essential part of that integrity which alone entitles a man to assume responsibility.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: God gave man work  not to burden him  but to bless him  and useful work  willingly  cheerfully  effectively done  has always been the finest expression of the human spirit.
author: Walter R. Courtenay

quote: Work is more fun than fun.
author: Noel Coward

quote: When more and more people are thrown out of work  unemployment results.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Man's usual routine is to work and to dream and work and dream.
author: Raymond Queneau

quote: We can redeem anyone who strives unceasingly.
author: Goethe

quote: The Gods rank work above virtues.
author: Hesiod

quote: Anyone can do any amount of work provided it isn't the work he is supposed to be doing at that moment.
author: Robert Benchley

quote: It is not upon thee to finish the work  neither art thou free to abstain from it.
author: The Talmud

quote: Work banishes those three great evils  boredom  vice  and poverty.
author: Voltaire

quote: Amateurs hope. Professionals work.
author: Garson Kanin

quote: Work is love made visible. And if you cannot work with love but only with distaste  it is better that you should leave your work and sit at the gate of the temple and take alms of those who work with joy.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: There is dignity in work only when it is work freely accepted.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Anyone who is honestly seeking a job and can't find it  deserves the attention of the United States government  and the people.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Work is the inevitable condition of human life  the true source of human welfare.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: He who shuns the millstone  shuns the meal.
author: Erasmus

quote: Rest is the sweet sauce of labour.
author: Plutarch

quote: God gives every bird its food  but he does not throw it into the nest.
author: J. G. Holland

quote: When your work speaks for itself  don't interrupt.
author: Henry J. Kaiser

quote: While I am busy with little things  I am not required to do greater things.
author: St. Francis de Sales

quote: For it is commonly said: accomplished labours are pleasant.
author: Cicero

quote: A people so primitive that they did not know how to get money except by working for it.
author: George Ade

quote: Work expands so as to fill the time available for its completion.
author: C. Northcote Parkinson

quote: I am only an average man  but  by George  I work harder at it than the average man.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Work is accomplished by those employees who have not yet reached their level of incompetence.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: The worst crime against working people is a company which fails to operate at a profit.
author: Samuel Gompers

quote: How do I work? I grope.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Work and love - these are the basics. Without them there is neurosis.
author: Theodor Reik

quote: The effectiveness of work increases according to geometric progression if there are no interruptions.
author: Andri Maurois

quote: The road to happiness lies in two simple principles: find what it is that interests you and that you can do well  and when you find it  put your whole soul into it-every bit of energy and ambition and natural ability you have.
author: John D. Rockefeller III

quote: Every woman is a human being-one cannot repeat that too often-and a human being must have occupation if he or she is not to become a nuisance to the world.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: The happy people are those who are producing something.
author: William Ralph Inge

quote: Congenial labor is essence of happiness.
author: Arthur Christopher Benson

quote: Work is a substitute "religious" experience for many workaholics.
author: Mary Daly

quote: When I can no longer create anything  I'll be done for.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: Employment is nature's physician  and is essential to human happiness.
author: Galen

quote: No thoroughly occupied man was ever yet very miserable.
author: Letitia Landon

quote: When I stop [working]  the rest of the day is posthumous. I'm only really alive when I'm working.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: Continuity of purpose is one of the most essential ingredients of happiness in the long run  and for most men this comes chiefly through their work.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: It is only when I am doing my work that I feel truly alive. It is like having sex.
author: Federico Fellini

quote: After fifty years of living  it occurs to me that the most significant thing that people do is go to work  whether it is to go to work on their novel or at the assembly plant or fixing somebody's teeth.
author: Thomas McGuane

quote: He who labors diligently need never despair  for all things are accomplished by diligence and labor.
author: Menander

quote: The fun of being alive is realizing that you have a talent and you can use it every day  so it grows stronger. ... And if you're in an atmosphere where this talent is appreciated instead of just tolerated  why  it's just as good as sex.
author: Lou Centlivre

quote: There are certain natures to whom work is nothing  the act of work everything.
author: Arthur Symons

quote: I am fierce for work. Without work I am nothing.
author: Winifred Holtby

quote: Like plowing  housework makes the ground ready for the germination of family life. The kids will not invite a teacher home if beer cans litter the living room. The family isn't likely to have breakfast together if somebody didn't remember to buy eggs  milk  or muffins. Housework maintains an orderly setting in which family life can flourish.
author: Letty Cottin Pogrebin

quote: When I die  my epitaph should read: She Paid the Bills.
author: Gloria Swanson

quote: There's no labor a man can do that's undignified  if he does it right.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: Never turn down a job because you think it's too small  you never know where it may lead.
author: Julia Morgan

quote: If a man is called to be a streetsweep-er  he should sweep streets even as Michelangelo painted  or Beethoven composed music or Shakespeare wrote poetry. He should sweep streets so well that all the hosts of heaven and earth will pause to say  here lived a great streetsweeper who did his job well.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Don't be afraid of hard work.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

quote: The work praises the man.
author: Irish proverb

quote: Originality and the feeling of one's own dignity are achieved only through work and struggle.
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

quote: There is a kind of victory in good work  no matter how humble.
author: Jack Kemp

quote: Labor disgraces no man  unfortunately  you occasionally find men who disgrace labor.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

quote: Honest labor bears a lovely face.
author: Thomas Dekker

quote: I have friends in overalls whose friendship I would not swap for the favor of the kings of the world.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: The world is moved not only by the mighty shoves of the heroes  but also by the aggregate of the tiny pushes of each honest worker.
author: Helen Keller

quote: A professional is someone who can do his best work when he doesn't feel like it.
author: Alistair Cooke

quote: The highest reward for man's toil is not what he gets for it  but what he becomes by it.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Starting out to make money is the greatest mistake in life. Do what you feel you have a flair for doing  and if you are good enough at it  the money will come.
author: Greer Garson

quote: Ambition is destruction  only competence matters.
author: Jill Robinson

quote: I was brought up to believe that the only thing worth doing was to add to the sum of accurate information in the world.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: Never desert your own line of talent. Be what nature intended you for  and you will succeed.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Here I am  where I ought to be.
author: Louise Erdrich

quote: To find in ourselves what makes life worth living is risky business  for it means that once we know we must seek it. It also means that without it life will be valueless.
author: Marsha Sinetar

quote: Everybody undertakes what he sees another successful in  whether he has the aptitude for it or not.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: You have to do what you love to do  not get stuck in that comfort zone of a regular job. Life is not a dress rehearsal. This is it.
author: Lucinda Basset

quote: Men take only their needs into consideration  never their abilities.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: If you're in a good profession  it's hard to get bored  because you're never finished-there will always be work you haven't done.
author: Julia Child

quote: Work means so many things! So many! Among other things  work also means freedom. ... Without it even the miracle of love is only a cruel deception.
author: Eleonora Duse

quote: One should stick to the sort of thing for which one was made  I tried to be an herbalist  whereas I should keep to the butcher's trade.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: One's lifework  I have learned  grows with the working and the living. Do it as if your life depended on it  and first thing you know  you'll have made a life out of it. A good life  too.
author: Theresa Helburn

quote: One principal reason why men are so often useless is that they neglect their own profession or calling  and divide and shift their attention among a multitude of objects and pursuits.
author: Nathaniel Emmons

quote: Men whose trade is rat-catching love to catch rats  the bug destroyer seizes on his bug with delight  the suppressor is gratified by finding his vice.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Work is creativity accompanied by the comforting realization that one is bringing forth something really good and necessary  with a conviction that a sudden  arbitrary cessation would cause a sensitive void  produce a loss.
author: Jenny Heynrichs

quote: Some people are born to lift heavy weights  some are born to juggle golden balls.
author: Max Beerbohm

quote: Life is to be lived. If you have to support yourself  you had bloody well better find some way that is going to be interesting. And you don't do that by sitting around wondering about yourself.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: To find out what one is fitted to do  and to secure an opportunity to do it  is the key to happiness.
author: John Dewey

quote: They are happy men whose natures sort with their vocations.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: I know a lot of people think it's monotonous  down the black lines over and over  but it's not if you're enjoying what you're doing. I love to swim and I love to train.
author: Tracy Caulkins

quote: Do your duty until it becomes your joy.
author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

quote: Duty is an icy shadow. It will freeze you. It cannot fill the heart's sanctuary.
author: Augusta Evans

quote: What a richly colored strong warm coat is woven when love is the warp and work is the woof.
author: Marge Piercy

quote: Whenever it is possible  a boy should choose some occupation which he should do even if he did not need the money.
author: William Lyon Phelps

quote: Some people regard discipline as a chore. For me  it is a kind of order that sets me free to fly.
author: Julie Andrews

quote: Find something you're passionate about and keep tremendously interested in it.
author: Julia Child

quote: There must be bands of enthusiasts for everything on earth-fanatics who shared a vocabulary  a batch of technical skills and equipment  and  perhaps  a vision of some single slice of the beauty and mystery of things  of their complexity  fascination  and unexpectedness.
author: Annie Dillard

quote: I love Mickey Mouse more than any woman I've ever known.
author: Walt Disney

quote: The test of a vocation is the love of the drudgery it involves.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Work is a world apart from jobs. Work is the way you occupy your mind and hand and eye and whole body when they're informed by your imagination.
author: Alice Koller

quote: I believe in my work and in the joy of it. You have to be with the work and the work has to be with you. It absorbs you totally and you absorb it totally.
author: Louise Nevelson

quote: Cooking is like love. It should be entered into with abandon or not at all.
author: Harriet Van Home

quote: Give me a man who sings at his work.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: To love what you do and feel that it matters-how could anything be more fun?
author: Katherine Graham

quote: When men are rightly occupied  their amusement grows out of their work  as the color-petals out of a fruitful flower.
author: John Ruskin

quote: When love and skill work together  expect a masterpiece.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Winning the [Nobel] prize wasn't half as exciting as doing the work itself.
author: Maria Goeppert Mayer

quote: When people go to work  they shouldn't have to leave their hearts at home.
author: Betty Bender

quote: Workaholics are energized rather than enervated by their work-their energy paradoxically expands as it is expended.
author: Marilyn Machlowitz

quote: The more I want to get something done  the less I call it work.
author: Richard Bach

quote: To deny we need and want power is to deny that we hope to be effective.
author: Liz Smith

quote: Success depends in a very large measure upon individual initiative and exertion  and cannot be achieved except by a dint of hard work.
author: Anna Pavlova

quote: Nothing worthwhile comes easily. Half effort does not produce half results  it produces no results. Work  continuous work and hard work  is the only way to accomplish results that last.
author: Hamilton Holt

quote: If a man wakes up famous  he hasn't been sleeping.
author: Wes Izzard

quote: Striving for success without hard work is like trying to harvest where you haven't planted.
author: David Bly

quote: If your dream is a big dream  and if you want your life to work on the high level that you say you do  there's no way around doing the work it takes to get you there.
author: Joyce Chapman

quote: Success is dependent on effort.
author: Sophocles

quote: Hard work has made it easy. That is my secret. That is why I win.
author: Nadia Comaneci

quote: Sweat plus sacrifice equals success.
author: Charles O. Finley

quote: The only thing that separates successful people from the ones who aren't is the willingness to work very  very hard.
author: Helen Gurley Brown

quote: You can have unbelievable intelligence  you can have connections  you can have opportunities fall out of the sky. But in the end  hard work is the true  enduring characteristic of successful people.
author: Marsha Evans

quote: In all human affairs there are efforts  there are results  and the strength of the effort is the measure of the result.
author: James Lane Allen

quote: Work  alternated with needful rest  is the salvation of man or woman.
author: Antoinette Brown Blackwell

quote: There is a time for work. And a time for love. That leaves no other time.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: Neither woman nor man lives by work  or love  alone.... The human self defines itself and grows through love and work: All psychology before and after Freud boils down to that.
author: Betty Friedan

quote: Maintain a good balance. A personal life adds dimensions to your professional life and vice versa. It helps nurture creativity through a deeper understanding of yourself.
author: Kathy Ireland

quote: For the happiest life  days should be rigorously planned  nights left open to chance.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: Work is the province of cattle.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: The only sin passion can commit is to be joyless.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: Skilled labor teaches something not to be found in books or in colleges.
author: Laura Towne

quote: Diligence is the mother of good luck  and God gives all things to industry.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: To industry  nothing is impossible.
author: Latin proverb

quote: I believe in hard work. It keeps the wrinkles out of the mind and spirit.
author: Helena Rubinstein

quote: God sells us all things at the price of labor.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: The sport I love has taken me around the world and shown me many things.
author: Bonnie Blair

quote: I realized that with hard work  the world was your oyster. You could do anything you wanted to do. I learned that at a young age.
author: Chris Evert

quote: Fortune is ever seen accompanying industry.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: Manual labor to my father was not only good and decent for its own sake  but as he was given to saying  it straightened out one's thoughts.
author: Mary Ellen Chase

quote: I get satisfaction of three kinds. One is creating something  one is being paid for it and one is the feeling that I haven't just been sitting on my ass all afternoon.
author: William F. Buckley

quote: The sentimentalist ages far more quickly than the person who loves his work and enjoys new challenges.
author: Lillie Langtry

quote: Busy people are never busybodies.
author: Ethel Watts Mumford

quote: What a man sows  that shall he and his relations reap.
author: Clarissa Graves

quote: The only way to enjoy anything in this life is to earn it first.
author: Ginger Rogers

quote: I have worked all my life  wanted to work all my life  needed to work all my life.
author: Liz Carpenter

quote: The simple idea that everyone needs a reasonable amount of challenging work in his or her life  and also a personal life  complete with noncompetitive leisure  has never really taken hold.
author: Judith Martin

quote: There is no more dreadful punishment than futile and hopeless labor.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Whether we call it a job or a career  work is more than just something we do. It is a part of who we are.
author: Anita Hill

quote: If I could I would always work in silence and obscurity  and let my efforts be known by their results.
author: Emily Bronte

quote: Nobody ever drowned in his own sweat.
author: Ann Landers

quote: The heights by great men reached and kept Were not attained by sudden flight  But they  while their companions slept  Were toiling upward in the night.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Work in some form or other is the appointed lot of all.
author: Anna Jameson

quote: Any man who has had the job I've had and didn't have a sense of humor wouldn't still be here.
author: Harry S. Truman

quote: Whatever the job you are asked to do at whatever level  do a good job because your reputation is your resume.
author: Madeleine Albright

quote: People should tell their children what life is all about-it's about work.
author: Lauren Bacall

quote: Marriage ain't easy but nothing that's worth much ever is.
author: Lillian Carter

quote: I don't think that work ever really destroyed anybody. I think that lack of work destroys them a hell of a lot more.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: For the last third of life there remains only work. It alone is always stimulating  rejuvenating  exciting and satisfying.
author: Kathe Kollwitz

quote: I slept  and dreamed that life was Beauty  I woke  and found that life was Duty.
author: Ellen Sturgis Hooper

quote: Passion is never enough  neither is skill.
author: Toni Morrison

quote: It's not the having  it's the getting.
author: Elizabeth Taylor

quote: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls  and looks like work.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Be strong! We are not here to play  to dream  to drift  We have hard work to do and loads to lift  Shun not the struggle-face it  'tis God's gift.
author: Maltbie D. Babcock

quote: If you could once make up your mind never to undertake more work ... than you can carry on calmly  quietly  without hurry or flurry ... and if the instant you feel yourself growing nervous and ... out of breath  you would stop and take a breath  you would find this simple common-sense rule doing for you what no prayers or tears could ever accomplish.
author: Elizabeth Prentiss

quote: It is better to have no emotion when it is work. Do what needs to be done  and do it coolly.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: What a man accomplishes in a day depends upon the way in which he approaches his tasks. When we accept tough jobs as a challenge to our ability and wade into them with joy and enthusiasm  miracles can happen. When we do our work with a dynamic  conquering spirit  we get things done.
author: Arland Gilbert

quote: The one important thing I have learned over the years is the difference between taking one's work seriously  and taking one's self seriously. The first is imperative  and the second is disastrous.
author: Margot Fonteyn

quote: Work is the best method devised for killing time.
author: William Feather

quote: Industry is a better horse to ride than genius.
author: Walter Lippman

quote: There are two kinds of talents  man-made talent and God-given talent. With man-made talent you have to work very hard. With God-given talent  you just touch it up once in a while.
author: Pearl Bailey

quote: If you want something done  ask a busy person to do it. The more things you do  the more you can do.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: With the power of conviction  there is no sacrifice.
author: Pat Benatar

quote: I believe you are your work. Don't trade the stuff of your life  time  for nothing more than dollars. That's a rotten bargain
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: When you're following your energy and doing what you want all the time  the distinction between work and play dissolves.
author: Shakti Gawain

quote: Work is the thing that stays. Work is the thing that sees us through.
author: Ellen Gilchrist

quote: Energy is the power that drives every human being. It is not lost by exertion but maintained by it  for it is a faculty of the psyche.
author: Germaine Greer

quote: It is not hard work that is dreary  it is superficial work
author: Edith Hamilton

quote: As for me  prizes mean nothing. My prize is my work.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: There can be no substitute for work  neither affection nor physical well-being can replace it.
author: Maria Montessori

quote: Work is its own cure. You have to like it better than being loved.
author: Marge Piercy

quote: Work ... has always been my favorite form of recreation.
author: Anna Howard Shaw

quote: A job is not a career. I think I started out with a job. It turned into a career and changed my life.
author: Barbara Walters

quote: The only genius that's worth anything is the genius for hard work.
author: Kathleen Winsor

quote: Elbow grease is the best polish.
author: English proverb

quote: Never despair  but if you do  work on in despair.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Laziness is a secret ingredient that goes into failure. But it's only kept a secret from the person who fails.
author: Robert Half

quote: Pears cannot ripen alone. So we ripened together.
author: Meridel Le Sueur

quote: Ideally  couples need three lives  one for him  one for her  and one for them together.
author: Jacqueline Bisset

quote: Exchange is creation.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: Whatever my individual desires were to be free  I was not alone. There were others who felt the same way.
author: Rosa Parks

quote: Now men and women are separate and unequal. We should be hand in hand  in fact  we should have our arms around one another.
author: Cloris Leachman

quote: Men and women are like right and left hands: it doesn't make sense not to use both.
author: Jeannette Rankin

quote: There are three ways of dealing with difference: domination  compromise  and integration. By domination only one side gets what it wants  by compromise neither side gets what it wants  by integration we find a way by which both sides may get what they wish.
author: Mary Parker Follett

quote: Women and men have to fight together to change society-and both will benefit.
author: Muriel Fox

quote: Every time a man unburdens his heart to a stranger he reaffirms the love that unites humanity.
author: Germaine Greer

quote: Good communication is as stimulating as black coffee  and just as hard to sleep after.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Cooperation is an intelligent functioning of the concept of laissez faire-a thorough conviction that nobody can get there unless everybody gets there.
author: Virginia Burden Tower

quote: Most leaders are indispensable  but to produce a major social change  many ordinary people must also be involved.
author: Anne Firor Scott

quote: Communication is a continual balancing act  juggling the conflicting needs for intimacy and independence. To survive in the world  we have to act in concert with others  but to survive as ourselves  rather than simply as cogs in a wheel  we have to act alone.
author: Deborah Tannen

quote: My whole life  whether it be long or short  shall be devoted to your service and the service of our great imperial family to which we all belong. But I shall not have the strength to carry out this resolution alone unless you join in it with me.
author: Queen Elizabeth II

quote: A person who believes ... that there is a whole of which one is a part  and that in being a part one is whole: such a person has no desire whatever  at any time  to play God. Only those who have denied their being yearn to play at it.
author: Ursula K. LeGuin

quote: Unless I am a part of everything I am nothing.
author: Penelope Lively

quote: For what is done or learned by one class of women becomes  by virtue of their common womanhood  the property of all women.
author: Elizabeth Blackwell

quote: We learn best to listen to our own voices if we are listening at the same time to other women-whose stories  for all our differences  turn out  if we listen well  to be our stories also.
author: Barbara Deming

quote: Remember the dignity of your womanhood. Do not appeal  do not beg  do not grovel. Take courage  join hands  stand beside us  fight with us.
author: Christabel Pankhurst

quote: Today whenever women gather together it is not necessarily nurturing. It is coalition building. And if you feel the strain  you may be doing some good work.
author: Bernice Johnson Reagon

quote: Women's art  though created in solitude  wells up out of community. There is  clearly  both enormous hunger for the work thus being diffused  and an explosion of creative energy  bursting through the coercive choicelessness of the system on whose boundaries we are working.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: You've got to be willing to stay committed to someone over the long run  and sometimes it doesn't work out. But often if you become real honest with yourself and honest with each other  and put aside whatever personal hurt and disappointment you have to really understand yourself and your spouse  it can be the most wonderful experience you've ever had.
author: Hillary Rodham Clinton

quote: We must stand together  if we don't  there will be no victory for any one of us.
author: Mother Jones

quote: I've always believed that one woman's success can only help another woman's success.
author: Gloria Vanderbilt

quote: Alone we can do so little  together we can do so much.
author: Helen Keller

quote: I always feel the movement is a sort of mosaic. Each of us puts in one little stone  and then you get a great mosaic at the end.
author: Alice Paul

quote: We all act as hinges-fortuitous links between other people.
author: Penelope Lively

quote: We seldom stop to think how many people's lives are entwined with our own. It is a form of selfishness to imagine that every individual can operate on his own or can pull out of the general stream and not be missed.
author: Ivy Baker Priest

quote: When Adam dolve  and Eve span  Who was then the gentleman?
author: John Ball

quote: Better to wear out than to rust out.
author: Bishop Cumberland

quote: The workers are the saviors of society  the redeemers of the race.
author: Eugene V. Debs

quote: Handle your tools without mittens.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Tools were made and born were hands  Every farmer understands.
author: William Blake

quote: I never did anything worth doing by accident  nor did any of my inventions come by accident  they came by work.
author: Thomas Alva Edison

quote: It's all in the day's work.
author: English Saying

quote: A ploughman on his legs is higher than a gentleman on his knees.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy.
author: James Howell

quote: I like work  it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours. I love to keep it by me: the idea of getting rid of it nearly breaks my heart.
author: Jerome K. Jerome

quote: And only the Master shall praise us  and only the Master shall blame  And no one shall work for money  and no one shall work for fame  But each for the joy of the working  and each  in his separate star  Shall draw the Thing as he sees It  for the God of things as They Are!
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: No man is born into the world whose work Is not born with him  there is always work  And tools to work withal  for those who will  And blessed are the horny hands of toil!
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: How many a rustic Milton has passed by  Stifling the speechless longings of his heart  In unremitting drudgery and care! How many a vulgar Cato has compelled His energies  no longer tameless then  To mould a pin  or fabricate a nail!
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Many hands make light work.
author: William Patten

quote: Heaven is blessed with perfect rest but the blessing of earth is toil.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: This world's a bubble.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: Believe everything you hear said of the world  nothing is too impossibly bad.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: The world is like a board with holes in it  and the square men have got into the round holes  and the round into the square.
author: Bishop Berkeley

quote: But in this world nothing is sure but death and taxes.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The year's at the Spring And day's at the morn  Morning's at seven  The hillside's dew-pearled  The lark's on the wing  The snail's on the thorn: God's in his Heaven -  All's right with the world!
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: I have not loved the world  nor the world me  I have not flatter'd its rank breath  nor bow'd To its idolatries a patient knee.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Socrates  indeed  when he was asked of what country he called himself  said  "Of the world"  for he considered himself an inhabitant and a citizen of the whole world.
author: Cicero

quote: Such stuff the world is made of.
author: William Cowper

quote: Come  follow me  and leave the world to its babblings.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: But it does move.
author: Galileo

quote: The world is a beautiful book  but of little use to him who cannot read it.
author: Carlo Goldoni

quote: The nations are as a drop of a bucket.
author: Isaiah

quote: World without end.
author: Isaiah

quote: It takes all sorts of people to make a world.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: If there is one beast in all the loathsome fauna of civilization I hate and despise it is a man of the world.
author: Henry Arthur Jones

quote: The world is God's world  after all.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: The world goes up and the world goes down  And the sunshine follows the rain  And yesterday's sneer and yesterday's frown Can never come over again  Sweet wife. No  never come over again.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: If all the world must see the world As the world the world hath seen  Then it were better for the world That the world had never been.
author: Charles C. Leland

quote: The world is full of beauty  as other worlds above  And if we did our duty  it might be as full of love.
author: Gerald Massey

quote: This world is all a fleeting show  For man's illusion given  The smiles of joy  the tears of woe  Deceitful shine  deceitful flow  -  There's nothing true but Heaven.
author: George Moore

quote: Half the world does not know how the other half lives.
author: Francois Rabelais

quote: This world surely is wide enough to hold both thee and me.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: There was all the world and his wife.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: A mad world  my masters.
author: John Taylor

quote: So many worlds  so much to do  So little done  such things to be.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: Everything is for the best in this best of all possible worlds.
author: Voltaire

quote: This world is a comedy to those who think  a tragedy to those who feel.
author: Horace Walpole

quote: Worry affects the circulation  the heart  the glands  the whole nervous system  and profoundly affects the health. You have never known a man who died from overwork  but many who died from doubt.
author: Charles W. Mayo

quote: Everybody knows if you are too careful you are so occupied in being careful that you are sure to stumble over something.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Worry is a god  invisible but omnipotent. It steals the bloom from the cheek and lightness from the pulse  it takes away the appetite  and turns the hair gray.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: A worried man could borrow a lot of trouble with practically no collateral.
author: Helen Nielsen

quote: If your eyes are blinded with your worries  you cannot see the beauty of the sunset.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: Worry often gives a small thing a big shadow.
author: Swedish proverb

quote: Bacteria and other microorganisms find it easier to infect people who worry and fret.
author: Leo Rangell

quote: Worry is a funky luxury when a lot has to be done.
author: Melvin Peebles

quote: Worries are the most stubborn habits in the world. Even after a poor man has won a huge lottery prize  he will still for months wake up in the night with a start  worrying about food and rent.
author: Vicki Baum

quote: There is nothing so wretched or foolish as to anticipate misfortunes. What madness is it in expecting evil before it arrives?
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Worry is like racing the engine of an automobile without letting in the clutch.
author: Corrie ten Boom

quote: Worry is evidence of an ill-controlled brain  it is merely a stupid waste of time in unpleasantness.
author: Arnold Bennett

quote: It ain't no use putting up your umbrella till it rains!
author: Alice Caldwell Rice

quote: Worry a little bit every day and in a lifetime you will lose a couple of years. If something is wrong  fix it if you can. But train yourself not to worry. Worry never fixes anything.
author: Mary Hemingway

quote: Worry is like a rocking chair-it keeps you moving but doesn't get you anywhere.
author: Corrie ten Boom

quote: Anxiety is the poison of human life  the parent of many sins and of more miseries.... Can it alter the cause  or unravel the mystery of human events?
author: Paxton Blair

quote: It only seems as if you are doing something when you're worrying.
author: L. M. Montgomery

quote: A hundredload of worry will not pay an ounce of debt.
author: George Herbert

quote: I am reminded of the advice of my neighbor. "Never worry about your heart 'til it stops beating."
author: E. B. White

quote: Worry is as useless as a handle on a snowball.
author: Mitzi Chandler

quote: When you worry  you go over the same ground endlessly and come out the same place you started. Thinking  on the other hand  makes progress from one place to another. ... The problem of life is to change worry into thinking  and anxiety into creative action.
author: Harold B. Walker

quote: I think these difficult times have helped me to understand better than before how infinitely rich and beautiful life is in every way  and that so many things that one goes around worrying about are of no importance whatsoever.
author: Isak Dinesen

quote: You always get negative reactions. If you worry about that  you would never do anything.
author: Tom Monaghan

quote: Anxiety never yet successfully bridged any chasm.
author: Giovanni Ruffini

quote: Cast away care  he that loves sorrow lengthens not a day  nor can he buy tomorrow.
author: Thomas Dekker

quote: You can't start worrying about what's going to happen. You get spastic enough worrying about what's happening now.
author: Lauren Bacall

quote: There are two days in the week about which and upon which I never worry. ... One of these days is Yesterday ... And the other day I do not worry about is Tomorrow.
author: Robert Jones Burdette

quote: We have to fight them daily  like fleas  those many small worries about the morrow  for they sap our energies.
author: Etty Hillesum

quote: T'ain't worthwhile to wear a day all out before it comes.
author: Sarah Orne Jewett

quote: Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow  but only saps today of its strength.
author: A. J. Cronin

quote: The really frightening thing about middle age is that you know you'll grow out of it!
author: Doris Day

quote: Never despair  but if you do  work on in despair.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: If you are doing your best  you will not have time to worry about failure.
author: Robert Hillyer

quote: It is not work that kills men  it is worry. Work is healthy  you can hardly put more upon a man that he can bear. Worry is rust upon the blade.
author: Henry Ward Hughes

quote: No good work is ever done while the heart is hot and anxious and fretted.
author: Olive Schreiner

quote: A day of worry is more exhausting than a day of work.
author: John Lubbock

quote: The reason why worry kills more people than work is that more people worry than work.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Worry is a form of fear.
author: Bertrand A. Russell

quote: Worry is a state of mind based on fear.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: Worry is a thin stream of fear trickling through the mind. If encouraged  it cuts a channel into which all other thoughts are drained.
author: Arthur Somers Roche

quote: If we would keep filling our minds with the picture of happy things ahead  many worries and anxieties  and perhaps ill health  would naturally melt away.... Always expect the best. Then if you have to hurdle a few tough problems  you will have generated the strength and courage to do so.
author: George Matthew Adams

quote: Turn resolutely to work  to recreation  or in any case to physical exercise till you are so tired you can't help going to sleep  and when you wake up you won't want to worry.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: A great many worries can be diminished by realizing the unimportance of the matter which is causing anxiety.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: We can always get along better by reason and love of truth than by worry of conscience and remorse. Harmful are these  and evil.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: As a cure for worrying  work is better than whiskey.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Every morning I spend fifteen minutes filling my mind full of God  and so there's no room left for worry thoughts.
author: Howard Chandler Christy

quote: Worry compounds the futility of being trapped on a dead-end street. Thinking opens new avenues.
author: Cullen Hightower

quote: Rule No. i is  don't sweat the small stuff. Rule No. 2 is  it's all small stuff.
author: Robert Eliot

quote: If only the people who worry about their liabilities would think about the riches they do possess  they would stop worrying. Would you sell both your eyes for a million dollars ... or your two legs ... or your hands ... or your hearing? Add up what you do have  and you'll find that you won't sell them for all the gold in the world. The best things in life are yours  if you can appreciate yourself.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: You'll break the worry habit the day you decide you can meet and master the worse that can happen to you.
author: Arnold Glasow

quote: Peace of mind is that mental condition in which you have accepted the worst.
author: Lin Yutang

quote: Of course I realized there was a measure of danger. Obviously I faced the possibility of not returning when I first considered going. Once faced and settled there really wasn't any good reason to refer to it again.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: What is there to be afraid of? The worst thing that can happen is you fail. So what? I failed at a lot of things. My first record was horrible.
author: John Mellencamp

quote: When you first learn to love hell  you will be in heaven.
author: Thaddeus Golas

quote: Accept that all of us can be hurt  that all of us can-and surely will at times-fail. Other vulnerabilities  like being embarrassed or risking love  can be terrifying  too. I think we should follow a simple rule: if we can take the worst  take the risk.
author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

quote: A wise man fights to win  but he is twice a fool who has no plan for possible defeat.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: There are people who are always anticipating trouble  and in this way they manage to enjoy many sorrows that never really happen.
author: Josh Billings

quote: The expectation of an unpleasantness is more terrible than the thing itself.
author: Marie Bashkirtseff

quote: Our worst misfortunes never happen  and most miseries lie in anticipation.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Some men storm imaginary Alps all their lives  and die in the foothills cursing difficulties which do not exist.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Most people go through life dreading they'll have a traumatic experience.
author: Diane Arbus

quote: How much pain they have cost us  the evils which have never happened.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The misfortunes hardest to bear are those which never happen.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: We poison our lives with fear of burglary and shipwreck  and the house is never burgled  and the ship never goes down.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: Do we not all spend the greater part of our lives under the shadow of an event that has not yet come to pass?
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: This was a great year for preventive worrying. Seldom in recent history have so many people worried about so many things that didn't happen in the end.
author: James Reston

quote: I remember the story of the old man who said on his deathbed that he had had a lot of trouble in his life  most of which never happened.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Needless fear and panic over disease or misfortune that seldom materialize are simply bad habits. By proper ventilation and illumination of the mind it is possible to cultivate tolerance  poise and real courage.
author: Elie Metchnikoff

quote: My life has been full of terrible misfortunes  most of which never happened.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Though life is made up of mere bubbles 'Tis better than many have  For while we've a whole lot of troubles The most of them never occur.
author: Nixon Waterman

quote: If you see ten troubles coming down the road  you can be sure that nine will run into the ditch before they reach you.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: The crisis you have to worry about most is the one you don't see coming.
author: Mike Mansfield

quote: Other Definitions of Worry Anxiety is the great modern plague. But faith can cure it.
author: Smiley Blanton

quote: Worry is the only insupportable misfortune of life.
author: Henry Saint John

quote: Worry is the cross which we make for ourselves by overanxiety.
author: Francois de Fenelon

quote: Worry is interest paid on trouble before it comes due.
author: William Ralph Inge

quote: Worry is a morbid anticipation of events which never happen.
author: Russell Green

quote: That man is blest Who does his best And leaves the rest  Then-do not worry.
author: Charles F. Deems

quote: Happy the man who has broken the chains which hurt the mind  and has given up worrying  once and for all.
author: Ovid

quote: If things happen all the time you are never nervous. It is when they are not happening that you are nervous.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Stop worrying about the potholes in the road and celebrate the journey!
author: Barbara Hoffman

quote: A request not to worry ... is perhaps the least soothing message capable of human utterance.
author: Mignon G. Eberhart

quote: It is the little things that fret and worry us  you can dodge an elephant  but not a fly.
author: Josh Billings

quote: To be rich is not the end  but only a change  of worries.
author: Epicurus

quote: A man ninety years old was asked to what he attributed his longevity. "I reckon " he said  with a twinkle in his eye  "it's because most nights I went to bed and slept when I should have sat up and worried."
author: Dorothea Kent

quote: Worry less about what other people think about you  and more about what you think about them.
author: Fay Weldon

quote: Don't hurry  don't worry. You're only here for a short visit. So be sure to stop and smell the flowers.
author: Walter Hagen
